item.description: Given after outstanding performance in the LEGO City Coast Guard game. Next rank is Captain.

item.name: Keep Module
item.description: Proud Stronghold of the House of Mantles, can be attacked by a Knight.
item.yieldDescription: Guest risks 1 Knight for a chance to win 10 House of Gauntlets Victory Ribbons. Owner risks 1 Catapult for a chance to win 10 House of Mantles Victory Ribbons.

item.name: Crest of the House of Gauntlets Module
item.description: Changes House of Gauntlets Victory Banners into Black LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Transforms 10 House of Gauntlets Victory Banners into 1 Black LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 10 per harvest.

item.name: Crest of the House of Mantles Modules
item.description: Changes House of Mantles Victory Banners into White LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Transforms 10 House of Mantles Victory Banners into 1 White LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 10 per harvest.

item.name: Castle Module
item.description: Proud Stronghold of the House of Mantles, can be attacked by a Dragon.
item.yieldDescription: Guests risk 1 Dragon for a chance to win 1 Black Brick. Owner risks 1 Stone Golem for a chance to win 20 House of Mantles Victory Ribbons.

item.name: Bio Networker Trade Module
item.description: Allows Users and Networkers to Trade.
item.yieldDescription: Can trade both mailable and non-mailable items on a Networkers' page.

item.name: Bio Networker Text Module
item.description: Read about Networkers on their pages!

item.name: Barrack Module
item.description: Proud Stronghold of the House of Gauntlets, can be attacked by a Pikeman.
item.yieldDescription: Guests risk 1 Pikeman for a chance to win 1 House of Mantles Victory Ribbon. Owners risk 1 Bowman for a chance to win 1 House of Gauntlets Victory Ribbon.

item.name: Bio Loop Shoppe
item.description: Allows you to buy Loops from Netwokers!
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend listed item price to buy the Loop. Remember you only need one of each type of Loop since you can use as many Loops in a SoundTrack as you'd like. This version of Loop Shoppe requires you to be friends with the Networker in order to trade.

item.name: Bastion Module
item.description: Proud Stronghold of the House of Gauntlets, can be attacked by a Catapult.
item.yieldDescription: Guest risks 1 Catapult for a chance to win 10 House of Mantles Victory Banners. Owner risks 1 Knight for a chance to win 10 House of Gauntlets Victory Banners.

item.name: Bio Sticker Shoppe
item.description: Allows you to buy Stickers from Networkers!
item.yieldDescription: Guest spend the listed cost to buy the Sticker. Remember you only need one of any particular sticker as you can use a Sticker as many times as you'd like in your Sticker Modules. This version of the Sticker Shoppe requires Networker friendship in order to trade.

item.name: Beta Sticker Shop Module
item.description: This is where you get your cool stickers for beta
item.yieldDescription: Get your stickers here

item.name: Fortress Module
item.description: Proud Stronghold of the House of Gauntlets, can be attacked by a Stone Golem.
item.yieldDescription: Guests risk 1 Stone Golem for a chance to win 1 White LEGO Brick. Owner risks 1 Dragon for a chance to win 20 House of Gauntlets Victory Ribbons.

item.name: Symbiosis Module
item.description: Share Grey LEGO Bricks with your Symbiotic Friend!
item.yieldDescription: Awards 1 Grey LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 50 clicks. Limit 7 Grey LEGO Bricks per harvest. Upon harvest, your symbiotic friend will recieve the same amount of Grey LEGO Bricks as you.

item.name: Galactic Sticker Module
item.description: Shows off your creativity and awards the Cruiser Hull Blueprint.
item.yieldDescription: Awards the Criuser Hull Blueprint after 350 Clicks. Clicks to this module may also trigger a Nebular Crystal to be sent to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Galatic Gallery Module
item.description: Shows off your Gallery Photo and awards the Cruiser Command Center Blue Print.
item.yieldDescription: Shows off your Gallery Photo. Awards the Cruiser Command Center Blue Print after 350 clicks. Clicks to this module may also trigger a Nebular Crystal to be sent to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Galatic Factory Module
item.description: Shows off your LEGO Factory model and awards the Cruiser Navigation System Blue Print.
item.yieldDescription: Awards the Cruiser Navigation System Blue Print after 350 Clicks. Clicks to this module may also trigger a Nebular Crystal to be sent to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Stardust Gallery Module
item.description: Shows off your creativity and awards the Cruiser Communication System Blue Print.
item.yieldDescription: Awards the Cruiser Communication System Blue Print. after 350 Clicks. Clicks to this module may also trigger a Nebular Crystal to be sent to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Stardust Factory Module
item.description: Shows off your LEGO Factory Model and awards the Cruiser Defense System Blue Print.
item.yieldDescription: Awards the Cruiser Defense System Blue Print after 350 Clicks. Clicks to this module may also trigger a Nebular Crystal to be sent to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Pet Punkling Module
item.description: A strange being from another dimension. Makes a great Pet!
item.yieldDescription: Grows 2 White LEGO Bricks a day, plus 1 for every 10 clicks. Limit 10 White LEGO Bricks per harvest. Clicks to this module also give a chance for a random friend on the owner's friendlist to be sent 1 Grey LEGO Brick.

item.name: Pet Robot Module
item.description: Your very own mechanical menace! Makes a great pet.
item.yieldDescription: Grows 2 Black LEGO Bricks a day, plus 1 for every 10 clicks. Limit 10 Black LEGO Bricks per harvest. Clicks to this module also give a chance for a random friend on the owner's friendlist to be sent 1 Grey LEGO Brick.

item.name: Sticker Shoppe
item.description: Allows you to buy Stickers from Networkers!
item.yieldDescription: Guest spend the listed cost to buy the Sticker. Remember you only need one of any particular sticker as you can use a Sticker as many times as you'd like in your Sticker Modules.

item.name: Rocket Game Module
item.description: A playable Rocket Game for your My LEGO Network Page!
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play a rocket game on your page by clicking to activate and spending 5 Red LEGO Bricks. Owner of the Rocket Game will recieve 5 Transparent LEGO Bricks each time this happens. Limit 25 Transparent LEGO Bricks per harvest.

item.name: Soundtrack Module
item.description: Plays your very own sound track for your My LEGO Network Page with loops you can collect from all over LEGO.com!
item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks. Plays a musical sample sequence of your own design!

item.name: Alien Egg Module
item.description: Hatches a Rocket Game Module Blueprint!
item.yieldDescription: Hatches the Rocket Game Module Blueprint after 1000 clicks.

item.name: Alter Ego Module
item.description: Reveals the owner's alter ego Avatar!
item.yieldDescription: Guests can click to reveal the owner's Alter Ego Avatar. This module also grows 5 Fairy Dust per day, plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 20 Fairy Dust per day.

item.name: Lightworm Module
item.description: A giant space worm that creates transparent bricks
item.yieldDescription: The Lightworm spins 1 Transparent LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 per 25 clicks. Limit 5 Transparent LEGO Bricks per harvest.

item.name: Pet Mountain Lion Module
item.description: A fun pet that teaches how to make it's high tech totemic counterpart
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Totemic Feed to click this module. After 100 clicks the owner will receive the Totemic Mountain Lion Blueprint. Keep in mind the Brickota Totem Pole Masterpiece is made a lot faster when you help your friends learn different Totemic Animals so that you can trade them, rather then building them all yourself.

item.name: Hop Arcade Game
item.description: Make your own obstacle course with MLN Hop Arcade game. Your friends will jump and duck to a mini-game of your own design! You can even customize the background, character and obstacles.
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play Hop Arcade game by clicking to activate and spending 1 Arcade Token. Owner of this Arcade Game will recieve 1 Arcade Token each time this happens. Limit 5 Arcade Tokens per harvest. Guest can win exclusive items such as Stickers, Arcade Tokens, Red, Yellow or Blue LEGO Bricks etc.

item.name: Brickkeeper Animation
item.description: Brickkeeper Animation

item.name: Destructoid Arcade Game
item.description: Building with LEGO is the ultimate fun but taking your creations apart comes in a close second – that’s what MLN Arcade’s Destructiod is all about!
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play Destructoid Arcade game by clicking to activate and spending 1 Arcade Token. Owner of this Arcade Game will recieve 1 Arcade Token each time this happens. Limit 5 Arcade Tokens per harvest. Guest can win exclusive items and Destructiod Arcade Module Blueprint.

item.name: Delivery Arcade Game
item.description: MLN's Delivery game lets you create and customize a maze-like neighborhood for friends to deliver goods before the time is up. The faster you play it - the tougher it will be to your friends.
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play Delivery Arcade game by clicking to activate and spending 1 Arcade Token. Owner of this Arcade Game will recieve 1 Arcade Token each time this happens. Limit 5 Arcade Tokens per harvest. Guest can win all sorts of exclusive items.

item.name: Dreaming Beam Infuser Module
item.description: A Gift from the Secret Satellite
item.yieldDescription: Infuses 10 Transparent LEGO Bricks per day, plus 1 for every 10 Clicks. Limit 20 per harvest.

item.name: Sticker Module
item.description: Displays a large, three slot, sticker composition.
item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks. Shows off your creativity!

item.name: LEGO Tree Module
item.description: A LEGO Tree that grows Red LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Grows 10 Red LEGO Bricks a Day, plus 1 more for every 5 clicks. Limit 50 per harvest.

item.name: Pet Glitch Module, Rank 1
item.description: Beta tester's reward module!
item.yieldDescription: Guests with the Beta Tester Badge can click on this module for a chance to win 1 Beta Bug. Owners will have a small chance of winning 1 Red LEGO Brick and sending a sticker to a random friend on their friendlist when this happens. This module also grows 20 Red LEGO Bricks a day plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 30 Red LEGO Bricks a day.

item.name: Solar Collecting Module
item.description: Harvests the power of the sun to create Yellow LEGO Bricks
item.yieldDescription: Grows 10 Yellow LEGO Bricks a Day, plus 1 more for every 25 clicks. Limit 25 per harvest.

item.name: Space Fuel Plant Gallery Module
item.description: Shows off a photo from your Gallery photos and grows Space Fuel cells.
item.yieldDescription: Grows 1 Space Fuel Cell per day plus 1 per 10 clicks.

item.name: Water Mill Module
item.description: Make Blue LEGO Bricks from hydropower!
item.yieldDescription: Grows 10 Blue LEGO Bricks per day, plus 1 for every 2 clicks. Limit 35 per harvest.

item.name: Capn Jack Animation
item.description: Capn Jack Animation

item.name: Hive Module
item.description: A Bee Hive that transforms Pollenated Bees and Mason Jars into Honey Pots!
item.yieldDescription: Uses 1 Pollenated Bee and 1 Mason Jar to Create 10 Honey Pots per day, plus 1 for every 15 clicks. Limit 20 Honey Pots per harvest.

item.name: May Pop Purple Popper Module
item.description: May Pop Purple Popper Module
item.yieldDescription: Transforms 2 Red LEGO Bricks and 2 Blue LEGO Bricks into 1 Purple LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 2 clicks. Limit 10 Purple LEGO Bricks per harvesty

item.name: Orange Mixing Truck Module
item.description: Mixes Red LEGO Bricks and Yellow LEGO Bricks to make Orange LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Transforms 5 Red LEGO Bricks and 5 Yellow LEGO Bricks into 1 Orange LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 20 Orange LEGO Bricks per day.

item.name: Prehistoric Fern Module
item.description: A large Prehistoric Fern which grows Green LEGO Bricks when fertilized with Yellow and Blue LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Transforms 2 Yellow LEGO Bricks and 2 Blue LEGO Bricks into 1 Green LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 15 Green LEGO Bricks per harvest.

item.name: Networker Trade Module
item.description: Allows Users and Networkers to Trade.
item.yieldDescription: Can trade both mailable and non-mailable items on a Networkers' page.

item.name: Trade Module
item.description: Allows Users to Trade Mailable Items
item.yieldDescription: Must be Set Up again after use to add more trade items to your module. To remove items from the Module, use the Tear Down button on your Public Page.

item.description: Numbchuck Animation

item.name: Scrap Yard Joe's Sticker Module
item.description: Shows off Stickers, Yields Yellow Bricks
item.yieldDescription: Create 10 Yellow LEGO Brick per Day, plus 1 for every 25 clicks. Limit 20 per harvest. This also has a chance of sending a gift to a random person on the module owner's friendlist.

item.name: Space Probe Mission Module
item.description: Use your Space Probe on this Module for a chance to Track down that no good Bob Skull!
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Space Probe on this Module for a Chance to win Bob Skull’s Coordinates, Owner has the same chance to win Bob Skull’s Coordinates on click as well.

item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks. Shows off your creativity!

item.name: Friendly Felix’s Concert Module
item.description: Create your own music game that plays along to your very own musical composition! Use the game editor to make your game as challenging as you’d like. Players can win cool items and blueprints.
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play Friendly Felix’s Concert Arcade game by clicking to activate and spending 1 Arcade Token. Owner of this Arcade Game will receive 1 Arcade Token each time this happens. Limit 5 Arcade Tokens per harvest. Guest can win items, stickers, exclusive LEGO Universe video and even their own LEGO Universe Public Skin.

item.description: Shows off a Networkers' Pictures!

item.name: Networker Text Module
item.description: Read about Networkers on their pages!

item.name: LEGO Club Magazine Module, Rank 1
item.description: A LEGO Club Magazine Exclusive Module that grows Red LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Grows 15 Red LEGO Bricks per day, plus 1 for every 1 clicks. Limit 75 Red LEGO Bricks per harvest. Guests must have a LEGO Club Magazine, Rank 1 Badge to click and have a chance to recieve 1 Red LEGO Brick each time they click.

item.name: Dinosaur Pet Module
item.description: A baby dino which awards your friends!
item.yieldDescription: This Dino Pet grows 5 Purple LEGO Bricks per 100 Clicks. Limit 5 Purple Brick per harvest. Guests clicks may trigger 1 Dino Scale to be sent to a random person on your friendslist.

item.name: Electric-Dam Module
item.description: A hub of activity for Beavers and Treason Beavers alike!
item.yieldDescription: This module requires 10 Beavers to run. Guests with the Treason Beaver can click on this module to attempt cause a flood, dumping 20 Blue LEGO Bricks to a random friend on the module owner's friendlist. After 20 clicks the module owner will receive the Water Mill Blueprint.

item.name: Farm Pet Module, Rank 1
item.description: Farm pets love apples!
item.yieldDescription: This module requires 10 Apples to run. Creates 20 Red LEGO Bricks for every 100 clicks. Limit 100 per harvest. Guests must spend 1 Apple to click this module. The farm pet may send out a fair amount of Strawberries to a random person on the module owner's friendlist.

item.name: Interstellar Ambush Module
item.description: Trick your friends into losing their space probes!
item.yieldDescription: Guests unknowingly risks 1 Space Probe. If ambushed, the guest loses their Space Probe and the Owner receives a Lost Space Probe. There is a small chance a mail will go out a person on the owner’s friendlist to inform them of their treachery.
item.fakeDescription: Use your Space Probe on this Module for a chance to Track down that no good Bob Skull!
item.fakeYieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Space Probe on this Module for a Chance to win Bob Skull’s Coordinates, Owner has the same chance to win Bob Skull’s Coordinates on click as well.

item.name: Farm Pet Module, Rank 2
item.description: Farm pets love apples!
item.yieldDescription: This module requires 25 Apples to run. Creates 100 Red LEGO Bricks for every 150 clicks. Limit 150 per harvest. Guests must spend 1 Apple to click this module. The farm pet may send out a loop to a random person on module owner's friendlist.

item.name: Merchobot Module
item.description: A robot that delivers Tires on demand... seems broken though?
item.yieldDescription: Due to Malfunction Merchobot sends out Tires to a random person on the module owner's friendlist. Also grows 1 tire per day. Limit 1 Tire per harvest.

item.name: Pet Ball Lightening Module
item.description: Makes for a strange baby brother indeed!
item.yieldDescription: Awards 1 Nail each day, plus 1 for every 20 clicks. Limit 20 Nails per day. The Ball Lightning may also send out 1 Loose Spark to a random person on your friendlist.

item.name: LEGO Universe Sticker Shoppe
item.description: Allows you to buy Stickers from Networkers!
item.yieldDescription: Guest spend the listed cost to buy the Sticker. Remember you only need one of any particular sticker as you can use a Sticker as many times as you'd like in your Sticker Modules.

item.name: Pet Golem Module
item.description: A stoney little friend.
item.yieldDescription: Awards 1 Nail each day, plus 1 for every 20 clicks. Limit 20 Nails per day. The Golem may also send out 1 Gypsum to a random person on your friendlist.

item.name: The Dinosaur Excavation Module
item.description: A large scale archaeological dig to unearth traces of the elusive Jeweled Triceratops
item.yieldDescription: You'll discover the Jeweled Triceratops Materpiece Blueprint after 500 clicks to this module. This module may send out a Rough Diamond to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: LEGO Universe Networker Text Module

item.name: Pet Water Bug Module

item.name: Quixotic Gallery Module
item.description: Shows off photos of your heroic LEGO creations. Grows Blue LEGO Bricks and offers your guests a chance to win a Heroic Story.

Keep in mind the Brickota Totem Pole Masterpiece is made a lot faster when you help your friends learn different Totemic Animals so that you can trade them, rather then building them all yourself.

item.name: Factory Module, Rank 2
item.description: Shows off your LEGO Factory models and grows Red LEGO Bricks!
item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks. Shows off your LEGO factory model. Grows 50 Red LEGO Bricks a day, plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 100 Red LEGO Bricks per harvest.

item.name: Floral Gallery Module
item.description: Displays a gallery photo, grows Red Flowers.
item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks. Shows off your gallery photo. Grows 1 Red Flower for every 20 clicks. Limit 10 per harvest.

item.name: Framer's Apprentice Factory Module
item.description: Displays LEGO Factory Models, awards a license.
item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks for your LEGO Factory Model. After 100 clicks awards the Roofing License.

item.name: Pet Wolf Module
item.description: A fun pet that teaches how to make its high-tech totemic counterpart.
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Totemic Feed to click this module. After 100 clicks the owner will receive the Totemic Wolf Blueprint. Keep in mind the Brickota Totem Pole Masterpiece is made a lot faster when you help your friends learn different Totemic Animals so that you can trade them, rather then building them all yourself.

item.name: Gallery Module
item.description: Displays Gallery Images
item.yieldDescription: Collects Clicks. Shows off your Gallery photos.

item.name: LEGO Gallery Module, Rank 2
item.description: Shows Gallery Module and Yields
item.yieldDescription: Collects Clicks. Shows off your gallery photo. Grows 15 Red LEGO Bricks per Day, plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 65 Red LEGO Bricks per harvest.

item.name: Plumber's Apprentice Factory Module
item.description: Displays LEGO Factory Models, awards a license.
item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks for your LEGO Factory Model. After 100 clicks awards the Plumbing License.

item.name: Pourman's Apprentice Gallery Module
item.description: Displays gallery images, awards a license.
item.yieldDescription: Collects clicks for your gallery photo. After 100 clicks awards the Foundation License.

item.name: BFF Module
item.description: Shows off your Best Friend Forever!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 20 Yellow LEGO Bricks per day, plus 1 for every 10 clicks. Limit 40 per day. At harvest your friend will be sent the same amount of Yellow LEGO Bricks you've earned.

item.name: Bee Battle Module, Rank 2
item.description: Battle Better Bees!
item.yieldDescription: Guest risks 1 Better Bee in battle for a chance to win 10 Honey Pots. Owner risks 1 Better Bee for a chance to win 12 Honey Pots.

item.name: Bee Battle Module, Rank 3
item.description: Battle Best Bees
item.yieldDescription: Guest risks 1 Best Bee in battle for a chance at winning 20 Honey Pots. Owner risks 1 Best Bee for a chance to win 25 Honey Pots.

item.name: Race Track Module, Rank 1
item.description: Compete in a race!
item.yieldDescription: Users with a Race Car, Rank 1 can use 1 Solar Power Cell to compete in a racing competition. The winner recieves 1 Victory Ribbon. This module requires 1 Solar Power Cell to run.

item.name: Race Track Module, Rank 2
item.description: Compete in a race!
item.yieldDescription: Users with a Race Car, Rank 2 can use 1 Solar Power Cell to compete in a racing competition. If the guest wins they recieve 2 Victory Ribbons, if the owner wins they recieve the Stunt Track, Rank 2 Module Blueprint. This module requires 1 Solar Power Cell to run.

item.name: Race Track Module, Rank 3
item.description: Compete in a race!
item.yieldDescription: Users with a Race Car, Rank 3 can use 1 Solar Power Cell to compete in a racing competition. If the guest wins they recieve 3 Victory Ribbons, if the owner wins they recieve the Stunt Track, Rank 3 Module Blueprint. This module requires 1 Solar Power Cell to run.

item.name: Stunt Track Module, Rank 1
item.description: Compete in a stunt challenge!
item.yieldDescription: Users with a Stunt Car, Rank 1 can use 1 Solar Power Cell to compete in a stunt competition. If the guest wins they recieve 1 Victory Ribbon, if the owner wins they recieve the Race Track Module, Rank 2 Blue Print. This module requires 1 Solar Power Cell to run.

item.name: Stunt Track Module, Rank 2
item.description: Compete in a stunt challenge!
item.yieldDescription: Users with a Stunt Car, Rank 2 can use 1 Solar Power Cell to compete in a stunt competition. If the guest wins they recieve 2 Victory Ribbons, if the owner wins they recieve the Race Track, Rank 3 Module Blue Print. This module requires 1 Solar Power Cell to run.

item.name: Stunt Track Module, Rank 3
item.description: Compete in a stunt challenge!
item.yieldDescription: Users with a Stunt Car, Rank 3 can use 1 Solar Power Cell to compete in a stunt competition. If the guest wins they recieve 3 Victory Ribbons, if the owner wins they recieve the Victory Trophy Blueprint. This module requires 1 Solar Power Cell to run.

item.name: Dino Grazing Module, Rank 1
item.description: A leafy field for Protoceratops to graze.
item.yieldDescription: Guest with a Protoceratops may spend 1 Green LEGO Bricks on this module to get a chance to win 1 Dino Scale. Each click provides a chance for the owner to receive a Dino Grazing Module, Rank 2 Blueprint, limit 1 per harvest.

item.name: Dino Grazing Module, Rank 2
item.description: A leafy field for Stegosarus to graze.
item.yieldDescription: Guest with a Stegosarus may spend 3 Green LEGO Bricks on this module to get a chance to win 10 Dino Scale. Each click provides a chance for the owner to recieve a Dino Grazing Module, Rank 3 Blueprint, limit 1 per harvest.

item.name: Dino Grazing Module, Rank 3
item.description: A leafy field for Brachiosarus to graze.
item.yieldDescription: Guest with a Brachiosarus may spend 5 Green LEGO Bricks on this module to get a chance to win 5 Dino Scale. Each click provides a chance for the owner to recieve 1 Dino Horn, limit 1 per harvest.

item.name: Flower Patch Module
item.description: Grows red flowers and pollenates bees!
item.yieldDescription: Guest may spend a Worker Bee on this module and recieve a Pollenated Bee in return. The owner of this module will recieve 1 Red Flower each time this happens. This module also grows 5 Red Flowers per day, plus 1 for every 20 clicks. Limit 10 Red Flowers per harvest.

item.name: Gated Garden Module
item.description: A gated garden with the initials P.O.S. on top.
item.yieldDescription: Guests must have a Seal of the P.O.S. to click. Guest also get a chance to recieve 1 Orange LEGO Brick by clicking. Owner will recieve 2 Orange LEGO Bricks per click.This module also grows 5 Orange LEGO Bricks per day. Limit 15 Orange LEGO Bricks per harvest.

item.name: Millstone Hurling Module
item.description: Use your Giants to hurl Millstones in contest of strength!
item.yieldDescription: Guest must have 1 Giant to compete with the Millstone Hurling Module. Guest and owner must each spend 1 Millstone for a chance to win. Upon winning the guest recieves 10 Blue LEGO Bricks and the owner recieves the Giant's Hat Masterpiece Blueprint.

item.name: Stardust Sticker Module
item.description: Shows off your sticker composition, awards the Cruiser Stealth System Blue Print.
item.yieldDescription: Awards the Cruiser Stealth System Blue Print after 350 Clicks. Clicks to this module may also trigger a Nebular Crystal to be sent to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Wind Mill Module
item.description: A Wind Mill that creates Blue LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Creates 5 Blue LEGO Bricks a day, plus an additional 5 per 20 clicks. Limit 15 Blue LEGO Bricks per harvest. Guest click to use a Wind Mill Tilter on this module for a chance to win a Giant Blueprint!

item.name: Agori Trophy Module
item.description: Part of BIONICLE campaign - Trophy Room. Beat your friends.
item.yieldDescription: Shows how many Bonehunter Blades the owner has.

item.name: Dino Ambush, Rank 1 Module
item.description: A sneaky trap to get Dino Fangs.
item.yieldDescription: Ambush guests for a chance to win 1 Dino Fang. Limit 3 Dino Fangs per harvest. Your unsuspecting guest risks losing their Green LEGO Bricks. A mail may be sent out to a random person on your friendlist warning them of your ambush.
item.fakeDescription: A leafy field for Protoceratops to graze.
item.fakeYieldDescription: Guest with a Protoceratops may spend 1 Green LEGO Bricks on this module to get a chance to win 1 Dino Scale. Each click provides a chance for the owner to recieve a Dino Grazing Module, Rank 2 Blueprint, limit 1 per harvest.

item.name: Dino Ambush, Rank 2 Module
item.description: A sneaky trap to get Dino Fangs!
item.yieldDescription: Ambush guests for a chance to win 10 Dino Fangs. Limit 9 Dino Fangs per harvest. Your unsuspecting guest risks losing their Green LEGO Bricks. A mail may be sent out to a random person on your friendlist warning them of your ambush.
item.fakeName: A leafy field for Stegosarus to graze.
item.fakeYieldDescription: Guest with a Stegosarus may spend 3 Green LEGO Bricks on this module to get a chance to win 10 Dino Scale. Each click provides a chance for the owner to recieve a Dino Grazing Module, Rank 3 Blueprint, limit 1 per harvest.

item.name: Dino Ambush, Rank 3 Module
item.description: A sneaky trap to get Dino Horns.
item.yieldDescription: Use the T-Rex to ambush guests for a chance to win 1 Dino Horn. Your unsuspecting guest risks losing their Green LEGO Bricks. A mail may be sent out to a random person on your friendlist warning them of your ambush
item.fakeDescription: A leafy field for Brachiosarus to graze.
item.fakeYieldDescription: Guest with a Brachiosarus may spend 5 Green LEGO Bricks on this module to get a chance to win 5 Dino Scale. Each click provides a chance for the owner to recieve 1 Dino Horn, limit 1 per harvest.

item.name: Pet Bat Module
item.description: A spooky pet that's full of surprises!
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Totemic Feed on this module for a chance to win 5 Purple LEGO Bricks. When clicked, this module has a small chance of granting the owner 1 Purple LEGO Brick and a chance to send out a sticker to a random friend on the owner's friendlist. This module also grows 1 Purple LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 3 clicks. Limit 10 Purple LEGO Bricks per day.

item.name: Pet Hawk Module
item.description: A fun pet that teaches how to make its high-tech totemic counterpart.
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Totemic Feed to click this module. After 100 clicks the owner will receive the Totemic Hawk Blueprint. Keep in mind the Brickota Totem Pole Masterpiece is made a lot faster when you help your friends learn different Totemic Animals so that you can trade them, rather then building them all yourself.

item.name: Pet Owl Module
item.description: A fun pet that teaches how to make its high-tech totemic counterpart.
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Totemic Feed to click this module. After 100 clicks the owner will receive the Totemic Owl Blueprint. Keep in mind the Brickota Totem Pole Masterpiece is made a lot faster when you help your friends learn different Totemic Animals so that you can trade them, rather then building them all yourself.

item.name: Pet Panther Module
item.description: A sneaky pet that's full of surprises!
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Totemic Feed on this module for a chance to win 5 Green LEGO Bricks. When clicked, this module has a small chance of granting the owner 1 Green LEGO Brick and a chance to send out a sticker to a random friend on the owner's friendlist. This module also grows 1 Green LEGO Brick per day, plus 1 for every 3 clicks. Limit 10 Green LEGO Bricks per day.

item.name: Elemental Earth Gallery Module
item.description: Show off your Gallery photos and create Elemental Earth!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 1 Elemental Earth per day, plus 1 for every 20 clicks. Limit 1 Elemental Earth per harvest. Guests recieve 1 Totemic Feed for each click spent on this module.

item.name: Elemental Air Gallery Module
item.description: Show off your Gallery photos and create Elemental Wind!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 1 Elemental Wind per day, plus 1 for every 20 clicks. Limit 1 Elemental Wind per harvest. Guests recieve 1 Totemic Feed for each click spent on this module.

item.name: Elemental Fire Factory Module
item.description: Show off your LEGO Factory Models and create Elemental Fire!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 1 Elemental Fire day, plus 1 for every 20 clicks. Limit 1 Elemental Fire per harvest. Guests recieve 1 Totemic Feed for each click spent on this module.

item.name: LEGO Universe Plastic Inductor Module
item.description: Shows off your LEGO Universe Creation Lab Creations and grows Plastic Pellets!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 5 Plastic Pellets per day, plus 1 more Plastic Pellet for every 10 Clicks. Limit 10 Plastic Pellets per harvest. This module also has a small chance of sending out a LEGO Universe themed Sticker to a person on the Owner’s friendlist when clicked.

item.name: Elemental Water Sticker Module
item.description: Show off your Sticker Compositions and create Elemental Water!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 1 Elemental Water per day, plus 1 for every 20 clicks. Limit 1 Elemental Water per harvest. Guests recieve 1 Totemic Feed for each click spent on this module.

item.name: LEGO CITY Trophy Module
item.description: Part of LEGO CITY - Trophy Room Module. Collect all the rewards from the game and show off to your friends.
item.yieldDescription: Shows how many rewards owner has collected from LEGO CITY Construction game.

item.name: LEGO Club Magazine Module, Rank 2
item.description: A LEGO Club Magazine Exclusive Module that grows Blue LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Grows 10 Blue LEGO Bricks per day, plus 1 for every 1 clicks. Limit 50 Blue LEGO Bricks per harvest. Guests must have a LEGO Club Magazine, Rank 1 Badge to click and have a chance to recieve 1 Blue LEGO Brick each time they click.

item.name: LEGO Club Magazine Module, Rank 3
item.description: A LEGO Club Magazine Exclusive Module that grows Yellow LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Grows 15 Yellow LEGO Bricks per day, plus 1 for every 1 clicks. Limit 30 Yellow LEGO Bricks per harvest. Guests must have a LEGO Club Magazine, Rank 1 Badge to click and have a chance to recieve 1 Yellow LEGO Brick each time they click.

item.name: Mantle's Transmuting Pool
item.description: Transmutes your White LEGO Bricks and a guest's Black LEGO Bricks into Grey LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Transmutes the owner's White LEGO Brick and the guest's Black LEGO Brick into 1 Grey LEGO Brick for each party. Limit 1 Grey LEGO Brick per harvest.

item.name: Electro-pellet Inductor Module
item.description: Shows off your LEGO Universe Creation Lab Creations and grows Plastic Pellets - improved version for LEGO Universe Newsletter subscribers!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 10 Plastic Pellets per day, plus 1 more Plastic Pellet for every 5 Clicks. Limit 20 Plastic Pellets per harvest.

item.name: Dr. Inferno’s Robot Simulator Module
item.description: Building with LEGO is the ultimate fun but taking your creations apart comes in a close second – that’s what MLN Arcade’s Destructiod is all about!
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play Doctor Inferno's Robot Simulator Arcade game by clicking to activate and spending 1 Arcade Token. Owner of this Arcade Game will receive 1 Arcade Token each time this happens. Limit 5 Arcade Tokens per harvest. Guest can win exclusive Items.

item.name: Code Module
item.description: Unlocks secrets...
item.yieldDescription: Users can get rewards and exclusive items by typing a valid code into this module.

item.name: Concert II Arcade Game
item.description: Create your own music game that plays along to your very own musical composition! Use the game editor to make your game as challenging as you’d like. Players can win cool items and blueprints.
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play Concert II Arcade game by clicking to activate and spending 1 Arcade Token. Owner of this Arcade Game will receive 1 Arcade Token each time this happens. Limit 5 Arcade Tokens per harvest. Guest can win exclusive items or Blueprint for own Concert II Arcade game.

item.name: Nebular Crystal Mine Module
item.description: Use your Autominer Bots to extract Nebular Crystals from deep space asteriod mines!
item.yieldDescription: Creates 1 Nebular Crystals per click, limit 5 Nebular Crystals per harvest. Requires the owner to use 1 Autominer Bot to set up this module. Guests must also use an Autominer Bot to click this module to recieve 1 Nebular Crystal.

item.name: Lumber Mill Module
item.description: Create Lumber for you to use in your constructions.
item.yieldDescription: Yields 15 Lumber a day, plus 1 for every 5 Clicks. Limit 45 Lumber per harvest.

item.name: Thornax Plant Module
item.description: A Thornax Plant that grows Thornax
item.yieldDescription: Grows 5 Thornax per day, plus 1 per 10 clicks. Limit 10 Thornax per Harvest

item.name: Bee Battle Module, Rank 1
item.description: Guest risks 1 Worker Bee in Battle for a chance to win 1 Honey Pot. Owner risks 1 Worker Bee for a chance to win the Drone Bee Blueprint.
item.yieldDescription: Battle your Worker Bees!

item.name: Loop Shoppe
item.description: Allows you to buy Loops from Netwokers!
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend listed item price to buy the Loop. Remember you only need one of each type of Loop since you can use as many Loops in a SoundTrack as you'd like.

item.name: BIO Jungle Adventure Sticker Module
item.description: Shows off your BIONICLE Sticker Composition
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Thornax for a chance to receive an Ancient Scroll. Owner’s receive 1 Thornax per 5 clicks. Limit 10 Thornax per Harvest

item.name: Desert Adventure Sticker Module
item.description: Shows off your BIONICLE Sticker Composition
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Thornax for a chance to receive the Desert Spring Locaction. Owner’s receive 1 Thornax per 8 clicks. Limit 15 Thornax per Harvest

item.name: Desert Ambush Module
item.description: This module looks the same as the Desert Adventure Sticker Module to your guests.
item.yieldDescription: When clicked guests risk losing their Thornax. After 5 successful ambushes the owner receives Iconox’s Favor. There is a chance this module will send out a message warning your friends of your treachery with every click.
item.fakeDescription: Shows off your BIONICLE Sticker Composition
item.fakeYieldDescription: Guests spend 1 Thornax for a chance to receive the Desert Spring Locaction. Owner’s receive 1 Thornax per 8 clicks. Limit 15 Thornax per Harvest

item.name: Gauntlet's Transmuting Pool
item.description: Transmutes your Black LEGO Bricks and a guest's White LEGO Bricks into Grey LEGO Bricks.
item.yieldDescription: Transmutes the owner's Black LEGO Brick and the guest's White LEGO Brick into 1 Grey LEGO Brick for each party. Limit 1 Grey LEGO Brick per harvest.

item.name: The Robot Chronicles Trophy Module
item.description: Shows a count of Magma Drones, Press Clippings, Hardhats, Agent Dossiers and Racing Trophies.
item.yieldDescription: Displays your collection of items from The Robot Chronicles.

item.name: Magma Drone Plant Module
item.description: Create you own legion of Magma Drones just like Doctor Inferno!
item.yieldDescription: Grows 1 Magma Drone a day plus 1 for every 5 Clicks, limit 10 per harvest.

item.name: Bonehunter Trap Module
item.description: Guests with Agori Hero Badge Rank 5 Spend 1 Thornax for a chance to win 1 Bonehunter Blade, for each click the owner receives a chance to win 1 Bonehunter Blade. Limit 1 Bonehunter Blade per harvest
item.yieldDescription: Battle your Agori Hero Badge, Rank 5 friends for Bonehunter Blades

item.name: Loop Shoppe
item.description: Allows you to buy Loops from Netwokers!
item.yieldDescription: Guests spend listed item price to buy the Loop. Remember you only need one of each type of Loop since you can use as many Loops in a SoundTrack as you'd like. This version of Loop Shoppe requires you to be friends with the Networker in order to trade.

item.name: Sticker Shoppe
item.description: Allows you to buy Stickers from Networkers!
item.yieldDescription: Guest spend the listed cost to buy the Sticker. Remember you only need one of any particular sticker as you can use a Sticker as many times as you'd like in your Sticker Modules. This version of the Sticker Shoppe requires Networker friendship in order to trade.

item.name: Garrison Module
item.description: Proud Stronghold of the House of Mantles, can be attacked by a Bowman.
item.yieldDescription: Guest risks 1 Bowman for a chance to win 1 House of Gauntlets Victory Banner. Owner risks 1 Pikeman for a chance to win 1 House of Mantles Victory Banner.

item.name: Pet Glitch Module, Rank 2
item.description: Beta tester's reward module!
item.yieldDescription: Guests with the Beta Tester Badge can click on this module for a chance to win 1 Blue Screen of Sadness. Owners will have a small chance of winning 1 Blue LEGO Brick and sending a sticker to a random friend on their friendlist when this happens. This module also grows 20 Blue LEGO Bricks a day plus 1 for every 5 clicks. Limit 30 Blue LEGO Bricks a day.

item.name: S.P.A. Sticker Vault
item.description: Some treasures from Patty Arch's Sticker Vault
item.yieldDescription: Free Stickers for members of the Sticker Preservation Afiliate.

item.name: Trio Performance Module
item.description: Allows you and two friends to create Hit Singles!
item.yieldDescription: This Module creates 1 Hit Single for every 2 clicks for both owner and two friends of their choice. Limit 10 Hit Singles per harvest. There is also a chance that the module will send out a Loop to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Group Performance Module
item.description: Allows you and three friends to make Hit Singles!
item.yieldDescription: This Module creates 1 Hit Single for every click for both owner and three friends of their choice. Limit 20 Hit Singles per harvest. There is also a chance that the module will send out a Loop to a random friend on the owner's friendlist.

item.name: Concert I Arcade Game
item.description: Create your own music game that plays along to your very own musical composition! Use the game editor to make your game as challenging as you’d like. Players can win cool items and blueprints.
item.yieldDescription: Guest can play Concert I Arcade game by clicking to activate and spending 1 Arcade Token. Owner of this Arcade Game will receive 1 Arcade Token each time this happens. Limit 5 Arcade Tokens per harvest. Guest can win exclusive Items or Blueprint for own Concert Arcade.

body.text: Thanks, you're a real buddy!

body.subject: Thanks!
body.text: It's nice working with you!

body.subject: I have reset your sticker module
body.text: Hi! I have reset your sticker module, because I don't like the words you have written...please behave in future, thanks! Thanks!

body.subject: Stop and Smell the Vorox
body.text: You enter the bone-lined desert cavern in search of the horrid Vorox. You hear a small crunching sound coming from behind you. As you turn to see where the noise is coming from you, find yourself face to face with the ferocious Vorox. The creature bends down and sweeps you up all the while flaring its nostrils. It seems you’ve got the right scent as the Vorox places you firmly back on the ground. I guess it’s time to get down to business.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Trade Thornax Stew for a Stinger Oath on the Vorox’s page.

body.subject: From beneath the sands
body.text: You encounter the Zesk as it emerges from the sands to attack. He looks hungry. Perhaps you should give him something else to consider for his lunch?

body.subject: Desperately Seeking Gresh?
body.text: Ah, of course, you’ve come to me seeking our great Glatorian hero, Gresh. Yes, I would be more than happy to make the introduction. But it would be irresponsible for me to send you any deeper into the undergrowth to find Gresh without making sure you're tough enough to endure. I’ll give you a little test. The jungles that both Gresh and I live in are filled with ancient artifacts. If you could bring me back an ancient scroll, I’ll point you the way to Gresh. Deal?[list]To Do List[/list][item]Click on your friends Jungle Adventure Sticker Modules for a Chance to win an Ancient Scroll[item]Mail the Ancient Scroll back to Tarduk[item]Build your own Jungle Adventure Sticker Module to help your friends and get more Thornax. Tarduk has the blueprint for this Module for trade on his page.

body.subject: Public Relations
body.text: As you might have heard from my friend Berix, Tajun, through no fault of it’s own, has gotten a bit of a bad name for itself. It seems our fellow Agori don’t trust that all of our salvaged treasures and weaponry from a recently discovered site are actually repaired and not, as they suspect, stolen. If you could help Berix and the rest of the water tribe clear our name by recovering another Ancient Spear, I will give you my seal for your contract and assist Vulcanus with its current bone hunter problem.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Befriend Berix if you haven’t already[item]Mail Tarix an Ancient Spear.

body.subject: The Thornax
body.text: Pay me and you’ll have my seal. There is nothing more to say that does not end in your defeat.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Trade with Skrall for his seal

body.subject: If you’re good with Iconox, you’re good with me
body.text: I see you got Iconox's Favor. That couldn’t have been easy. You must have had to bend the rules a bit to get to me. I like that. Sure, you can have my support in your campaign against the bone hunters – if anything, it will allow me to show off my new moves to the other Glatorian. Or maybe I’ll pretend to fight poorly so they underestimate me next time I face them in the arena. Oh, I am good. If you keep quiet about my little plan, you can trade with me for an upgrade to your Agori badge and that should get you the respect of the rock tribe, and Skrall’s seal.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Trade with Strakk for his seal[item]Trade with Strakk for the Agori Honor Badge, Rank 4 Blueprint[item]Befriend Atakus

body.subject: You’ve been getting around Bara Magna
body.text: Well, well… You stepping in on my business? I’ve heard from a number of Glatorian about you. Surprised it took you long to come my way. So, I’ve heard you're looking to get some buy in on a plan to save Vulcanus? That’s real sweat and all, but what’s in it for you? There’s gotta be something. Okay, check it out, your last two seals are going to be nearly impossible without me. So here’s the deal. I need you to help me track down a certain piece of real estate: a Desert Spring. I want to claim it for its water and the valuable plants that grow around it. [list]To Do List[/list][item]Find the Desert Spring Location by clicking on your friend’s Desert Adventure Sticker Module[item]Help your friends by Building your own Desert Adventure Sticker Module, its blueprint is available on Metus’ page

body.subject: Vision in the Embers
body.text: You have come! Thank the flames! Vulcanus has been suffering under the daily raids of the bone hunters – a primitive and savage group that roams the wastelands of Bara Magna trying to seize every resource they can. I began to just accept that our lot in life was to suffer these raids and eventually surrender. But I have hoped that someday, someone would help my people out of this bleak future. As you know, we Agori solve most of our problems in the arena with mighty Glatorian fighting on our behalf. One of our champions was named Malum. His brutality was uncontrollable – and that was the reason for his exile. We need to find him and convince him to fight for Vulcanus once more. I cannot spare a single Agori to search for him. Could you track him down? [list]Hint[/list][item]Do you need help to kick start this story? Send a message to Raanu with the subject “Could you please give me a hint?” and check your mail.

body.subject: Missing Copy Jamie (Creator)
body.text: Missing Copy Jamie (Creator)

body.subject: About that Retuned Tuning Fork
body.text: Great job overcoming the My LEGO Network Challenge! Did I mention that Retuned Tuning Fork parts like the Endless Ohm and the Heliotropic Harpoon Handle are a bit tricky to come by? No? Well, in the known universe, only a ninja leader named Numb Chuck can chant the Endless Ohm. Don’t believe all that you may hear about Chuck! After all, science has proven that smashing bricks with mind power alone is very nearly close to impossible! Also, the last known holder of a Heliotropic Harpoon Handle is Captain Jack Knife of the Barracuda Pirates. The chances of Jack trading for the Handle are—let’s see here…Well, maybe you’ll catch him in a good mood! One last thing! Relations between the pirates and ninjas are, um, a bit awkward—openly hostile really. Good luck then! Friendly Felix will be thrilled if—I mean when you take him a Retuned Tuning Fork! [list]To Do List[/list][item]Visit Numb Chuck and Captain Jack Knife.[item]Trade for the parts of a Retuned Tuning Fork.

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept once more. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: Missing Copy Simon (Creator)
body.text: Missing Copy Simon (Creator)

body.subject: Missing Copy Simon (Creator)
body.text: Missing Copy Simon (Creator)

body.subject: Glitch Error in your favor?
body.text: Look what {Sender}'s Pet Glitch Module has for you! A cool Sticker that you can use over and over again on your own page!

body.subject: You think that? About me? Wow!
body.text: You mean it? Why nobody has ever been so nice to me! Do you think maybe I'm good enough to quit this job and being come a full time Bee Battle Coach? Yeah... I don't think there's much of a market for that either. Oh Well.

body.subject: Thanks, but this reminds me...
body.text: I'm so sorry. I don't mean to be rude, but seeing this little plant all cramped up in this pot reminds me of being here at the office. You don't happen to have just some regular old Red Flowers, do you? That would just make my day!

body.subject: N/A (no need - no pre req)
body.text: N/A (no need - no pre req)

body.subject: Nebular Reward!
body.text: You discover a hidden crystal from {Sender}'s Page!

body.subject: The trinket ye be seekin’
body.text: Felix be in a fix ye say? Har har! But how I loves shakin’ me booty while Felix be blastin’ his guitar! Fancy a bit o’ root beer while we talk o’ the Heliotropic Harpoon Handle ye wants? See, like a bloomin’ flower the Handle bends to the sun, so aimin’ her be harder than a hornpipe! Yar, she be o’ little use for ‘poonin’, but me beauty be a mighty rare trinket still! I’d only give over me Heliotropic Harpoon Handle in trade fer a bit o’ Sea Monster Bait. Let’s just say I got me reasons fer wantin’ to lure one o’ them slithery swimmers! I know how to make Sea Monster Bait, but I still needs a couple o’ pieces! If ye brings me them wee baity bits, yar the Handle be yers! Off with ye then! Arrr!![list]To Do List[/list][item]Trade for the Koi Sushi required to build Sea Monster Bait on Numb Chuck’s page.

body.subject: Data is in the air!
body.text: Great! As promised, here's the blueprints for transmitter. You'll need this for your Totem Pole. Best of luck!

body.subject: I don’t think you have the right guy
body.text: Look, I’m not sure how you found me and I really don’t care how you did. I think you have me confused with one of those weak little Agori tribesman - maybe from my former village of Vulcanus. Go see Raanu – maybe he could help you. Or don’t, I really don’t care.

body.subject: Now why would I help you?
body.text: So… Vulcanus needs me now, is that it? And they send you? Pathetic. Well, I will do nothing to help Raanu or any of those other Agori weaklings. However – if you could find me some ammo I might be able to figure something out.

body.subject: A Plan
body.text: You’ve had quite a time getting this far, haven’t you? And all to help the fire tribe, who are pretty much strangers to you. You know, Bara Magna doesn’t see a lot of your type, people who do things just because it's the right thing to do. We Glatorians see things in more practical terms - we fight who we're paid to fight. Maybe that’s it? Perhaps we could solve Raanu’s problem not by appealing to the Glatorian’s sense of good, but simply getting them contracted to help. If you wouldn’t mind sending me a Thornax, I can extract the nectar for the ink for a contract and we can get started.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Send Gresh a Thornax

body.subject: Download this!
body.text: You've got the note of thanks! Wow! Well... let me just say from me and all the other developers at My LEGO Network - THANK YOU!!!!!! You helped us so much with the MLN Beta Test. On my page you can find some cool trades for some more modules, items, stickers and loops. All exclusively for Beta Testers like you. I hope you enjoy!

body.subject: Did you clear your cache?
body.text: I'm sorry buddy... I can only be friends with those that reached Rank 1 or higher during the My LEGO Network Beta Test and have Echo's Note of Thanks. There's so many other cool people to be friends with though - try, oh say Farmer John! I wish I worked outside with my hands like him, instead of hunched over these computers.[list]Hint[/list][item]Prove to us that you are a skilled gamer or have strong creative skills and maybe you are next in line.

body.subject: A bit off course?
body.text: I’m not sure how you’ve stumbled across me here in this remote part of the Jungle but you need to get out of here as quickly as possible! You aren’t ready for the jungle’s trials.

body.subject: Award
body.text: Congratulation. You got the engine in the Racers Game.

body.subject: Award
body.text: Congratulation. You got the left Front Tire.

body.subject: I didn’t do it
body.text: Look. I know we don’t know each other very well and I’m not sure what you’ve heard about me but none of it is true. Everything I have, I’ve salvaged. I never have stolen anything from the Atero Trophy offering. I’ve never even seen it! I can convince everybody from Tarjun to pitch in and help Vulcanus, including Tarix, but I’m not sure Raanu would even want our help until my name is cleared. If you could find a means of making another Ancient Spear, we could prove to the rest of the tribes that I’m not what they think I am. When you have it, send it to Tarix. He’ll sort things out, then I’m sure he’ll help you anyway he can![list]To Do List[/list][item]Get the Ancient Spear Blueprint from Berix’s page[item]Look around BIONICLE.com for the spear fragments and any other parts needed to make a new spear[item]Send the an Ancient Spear back to Tarix

body.subject: I don’t think you want to be associated with me
body.text: I’m not exactly the most loved Agori at the moment. I don’t want people to think you’re part of any ring of thieves or anything. Come back later when you’ve at least got the jungle tribe on your side.

body.subject: Making things simple
body.text: We here in the rock tribe have watched from a distance, with some amusement, as you’ve gone from tribe to tribe trying to gain their trust. Unlike the other Agori, the Skrall are direct: our loyalty is temporary and for sale. You pay me, I’ll get you to Skrall. You pay him and he’ll pledge to fight with his seal. It’s that easy.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Trade with Atakus for his mark[item]Befriend a Skrall

body.subject: Come back later
body.text: You must have more honor with the Agori before gaining an audience with the Skrall.

body.subject: Dig a little deeper...
body.text: You look like a very promising candidate for studying dinosaurs and seem like you have that look of an adventurer about you. Never the less, I must ask you to come back once you have constructed the Speedy Motorcycle Masterpiece. Only then will you truly be ready.

Well alright! Thanks for making me your buddy! I been on the stunt racing scene for many a year and now I'm turning my attention to what I see as the ultimate trick: getting my cars to run on another, cheaper, type of fuel. I'm converting engines to run on everything from sun rays to soil. Yep! Nothing quite panning out yet... but that shouldn't stop a fella from trying. If you got any extra Engines for my little science experiments I'd surely be in your debt.

body.subject: Glad you signed up with us!
body.text: Well, well! Looks like you are ready to roll with Dino Attack team! Congrats! If you can prove you're up for a challenge by sending me a Dino Scale - I'll teach you to build a Dino Bone Gallery Module. They're pretty great for getting those Green LEGO Bricks.

body.subject: I think you need some more time...
body.text: Sorry, I think you need some more time to improve your skills before you're ready to roll with me and the Dino Attack team. Come back when you are Rank 4 or higher. Stay alert, stay fast!

body.subject: You're a very bright person!
body.text: Greeting! As you may know I'm taking some time off from Alpha Team to research Solar Power solutions for automobiles. It's pretty exciting, but a lot of work! I could sure use a bright mind like yours to help me - if come across any spare Engines, I could really use them. I keep breaking them during my trial runs.

body.subject: I'd love to trade!
body.text: Trade? Ok! If you send me an Apple Pie, and it's up to my very high pie standards, I will send you the Crimon Apple Masterpiece Blueprint. That will make you Rank 1! When you're done be sure and drop by my page to see all me other trades. Cheers Mate!

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: Confused? So Sorry Mate. Click on me Avatar on your friendlist to go to my page and see all the trade offers I have. Or better yet - why don't you go into your inventory and make me one of them Apple Pies - I'm so hungry! First get the Apple Pie Blueprint from Echo - I think he'll trade you for an Apple if I'm not mistaken. Then build an Apple Pie and drop it in the mail to me. Mmm... Can't wait! Cheers![list]To Do List[/list][item]Go to your Inventory.[item]Construct 5 Apples and use those to construct the Apple Pie.[item]Send a mail to Farmer John with the Apple Pie attached.[item]Check mail.

body.subject: Thank you!
body.text: Great! This little guy will have a wonderful time in my garden! Hey you ever think about growing your own flowers?

body.subject: You cheered me up!
body.text: This is so nice of you! It really makes my day. My favorite thing to do is Battle Bees as you might know. Try this. If you win you can get a Drone Bee. I guess being a Drone isn't so bad after all? Who am I kidding - I need a new job!

body.subject: Too Slow!
body.text: You can't keep up with me until you're Rank 3, sorry!

body.subject: Neck and Neck
body.text: Hey Man! Thanks for the friendlist add. I can see we are pretty equal in terms of our LEGO building skills - but wow, I gotta say I could teach you a thing or two about racing. No worries - that's why I'm here. But dig this - I gotta get myself a new engine. I kinda burned a few out, you guessed it, doing wheelies. If you can hook me up I'll return the favor.

body.subject: Ok, yeah, cool.
body.text: Wow. Ok. So like now that we are friends I just wanted to say like ok, yeah! Let's build some stuff together - because like I can totally teach you how to build some Wind Mills. Well - they are kinda hard to build cause like - it's you know - kinda technical. But I mean, it comes from a rich tradition from like history and junk or something like I totally learned in school. I'm guess I'm not good with history but I'm totally awesome at like engineering. Like sometimes people think those are like two halves of the brain or something like that. Like I'm this half, I'm good at a math and junk - no I'm this half let's have art time. Wonder if they get cookies and juice at art time? I did. Oh wait, what was I saying? Oh right, we're now friends. Yeah! Ok so like, get this, I'm working on this new Mill design and I’m not sure it's going to work but if you had like some extra help from some of those cute little Beavers Pel Tonne is always hanging around with I could like total try it out. Send me one, please?

body.subject: No, No, You are not ready young squire...
body.text: There are many dangers luring in the darkness.... Dragons! Giants! Dark Riders with shadowy intent... My friend, though your heart is true, and your craving for adventure is great, you must return to me when you are more experienced. Perhaps the Royal Hive Queen will dub you a squire so that you can ride with me... for glory!

body.subject: I dreamed of this day...
body.text: I dreamed one day a person with your purity of heart would enlist with me to ride out with honor for glory. But, and it pains me greatly to say this, I doubt those things "mean" anything to people anymore. Perhaps the other Networkers are right, I'm an old fool. I should just sit by the fire an return to my books - at least in stories things make sense. You don't happen to have any books? The kind with heroic tales of good men and brave deeds? That would bring me great joy.

body.subject: Well... No. Here's why!
body.text: Oh my gosh! So like you wanted to be friends? And yeah I get that. But then I was thinking "well yeah they are cool so maybe" but like "no" because I was thinking I'd just have to explain too much to them because like I do know a lot about building, I mean come on look at my Wind Mills, but if I like had go way back and explain like how you even just make an Apple and stuff I think like we might just be here all day with me talking and going on and you just being like oh yeah I'm learning but this boring because I just want to build and stuff. So what do you say to coming back after you've built the Royal Hive Queen Masterpiece, I mean that's like really hard but not too hard so that like you know more than me cause I mean what would be the point. Well I mean we could just, I guess, just hang out and that would be cool, but I mean Echo told me to like help you guys, and stuff, because I'm like awesome at building. So like ok, come back?

body.subject: You need to grow a little more...
body.text: Sorry, I can't be your friend until you've made the Crimson Apple Masterpiece. We just wouldn't have anything to talk about otherwise!

body.subject: I can't talk now
body.text: I can't talk to you until you have built the Royal Hive Queen! Oh... so sorry. I don't mean to yell. I get a little angry sometimes, when I'm late with a project... Like now, I can't finish my plans without my T-Square.

body.subject: Unblocked from your friendlist
body.text: {Sender} has unblocked you from their friendlist. So glad you're getting along again!

body.subject: Blocked!
body.text: {Sender} has blocked you from being their friend. Don't take it so hard, Echo still thinks you are awesome!

body.subject: Now that's over with, let's get mixing!
body.text: Great. Sorry for all that red tape, but trust me, it's just the beginning if you want to make the Craftsman Cottage. That ol' Bur O Crat sure knows how to slow us down! So, here's how to make a module that will transform your Red and Yellow LEGO Bricks in Orange LEGO Bricks. Now get mixing! You don't want to pour a cold joint.When you want to get your Foundation license just send me a Form 20B and we can get started.

body.subject: Application for Sticker Accepted
body.text: Here's a sticker from my personal collection. How I enjoy to see the police get their man. Good Day.

body.subject: Application for Help Accepted
body.text: You must first pay your Digging Fine on my page. Send recipet of that to Connie Crete to get a source for Orange LEGO Bricks. Come back to my page and trade those Orange Bricks for Form 20B. Then go see your contractors, El Ectric, Connie Crete, Ron Roofer and Dip Gimlet to get some modules that will get you your building licenses with Form 20B. Then come back to me for your permits. Send those permits back to the contractors to get the blueprints for parts of the Craftsman's Cottage. It seems very simple to me. Good Day.

body.subject: Friendlist request rejected
body.text: {Sender} has rejected your friendlist request. Don't take it too hard, is {Sender} THAT cool anyway?

body.subject: A New Friend!
body.text: {Sender} has accepted your friendlist request, and is now your friend.

body.subject: Application for Plumbing Permit Accepted
body.text: Let's see... yes, this appears to be in order. Permit granted. Good Day.

body.subject: Error! Can not unblock from friendlist.
body.text: Error! {Sender} can not unblock you from their friendlist. This is quite a pickle!

body.subject: Application for Roofing License Accepted
body.text: You papers are in order, excellent. Here is your permit. Good Day.

body.subject: You seek knowledge?
body.text: If you don't have all the fragments, keep searching the Network. The ladies you are looking for are all skilled gardeners, most likely ones you have met already.

body.subject: Sound advice
body.text: I offer this to you, as I have offered it to many mortal kings before you. Play not the drums of battle, rejoice cousin for spring will be upon us soon.

body.subject: My steed
body.text: I hope you enjoy this portrait of my mighty steed. You might us flying through the night sky on the first day of spring.

body.subject: Initiation
body.text: With this seal, I hereby bestow the rank of initiate of the Phantom Orchid Society upon you. Upon constructing this secret seal you will be given access to the Gated Garden Module on other initiate's pages. I know you must have a lot of questions about the Order and about me. I can not, at this time, reveal to you the full truth as you will find it too... overwhelming. I will tell you this. I walked this Earth long before the Dinosaur. I helped the first farmers to harvest their crops. I have advised many of your mortal kings, rulers, and presidents. I gave them and their people food when they were hungry... but in the end, they all broke their promises and chopped down the forests to wage pointless battles over imaginary lines in the Earth. That is why I hid away, revealing myself to only those with keen senses and pure heart, like yourself. Be warned that when you speak my name, some may not believe that I am real. Only those who know the scent of the Phantom Orchid can see me. Stay in bloom.

body.subject: I will help you
body.text: Flower for you thoughts? Oh, you are in need. Well, go see Dr. Killroy! He's a very wise man indeed, for someone as young as he is. If you need help with Dinosaurs, go see Shadow, Digger or Viper. Those boys are very brave. If you need help from me, well... I think you know what to send me, and if you don't, then maybe you should, just stop looking. br

body.subject: Application for Electrical Permit Accepted
body.text: Curious, it seems you have everything filled in perfectly. I didn't expect this. Well here's your permit. Good Day.

body.subject: Ancient Sounds
body.text: It pleases me greatly share these sounds with you. The player is none other then, ....... well, "you know who." Recorded on the anceint clay spinning discs over two thousand years ago in the high court of Atlantis.

body.subject: Looking for a hand out, eh?
body.text: Heh! Just joshing with you, kiddo. Yeah of course you can have a sticker. Hope you like it.

body.subject: Are you a member?
body.text: If you sign up for the free LEGO Club Magazine online you'll can recieve the LEGO Club Magazine Badge, Rank 1. Once you've constructed the badge you can be friends with Max and get cool modules like the ones on 's page!

body.subject: Oh kiddo...
body.text: You're breaking my heart. I know I'm not the best role model, but I really thought you'd stop all this and do the right thing. Take care kiddo - let this sticker remind you of the weeks you spent collecting all those Dino Fangs. Yeah, read the blueprint! Top of the food chain comes at a cost.

body.subject: It's not too late to change your ways!
body.text: I'm so glad you feel that way. Hey, I'm no boy scout, but I just think ambushing your own friends is a little low, even if does get the job done faster. Here you go - build one of these guys, get back out there, do the right thing graze your way to getting the Dino Horns.

body.subject: Good show!
body.text: Stiff upper lip, chap. Don't panic. First send me Solar Power Cell, then you can get started with your Dino Grazing Modules. Be sure and visit the members of the Dino Attack team to pick up all the dino blueprints you'll need. And last but not least, see Jen Juniper for ways to get Green and Purple LEGO bricks. Ta Ta.

body.subject: Sound sounds from my travels
body.text: During my travels in southern India I learned to play the Sitar a bit. I'm afraid I've gotten a bit rusty - but never the less I hope you enjoy my little raga.

body.subject: For you and your Best Friend!
body.text: Wonderful! Construct this module and you'll be able to grow Yellow LEGO Bricks - but each time you harvest them, your best friend will get the same amount of bricks! In the editor of your BFF module you can select the friend you would like to share your harvest with.

body.subject: Great job!
body.text: Well, hi! So you did find the Rocket Game and actually made it all the way. Great to see so skilled gamers on the Network! Now you want to collect, ha? Are you ready to be friend with me yet? Go to my page and find out.

body.subject: SW game 09: Sith collection 5a
body.text: SW game 09: Sith collection 5a

body.subject: SW game 09: Sith collection 4a
body.text: SW game 09: Sith collection 4a

body.subject: SW game 09: Sith collection 3a
body.text: SW game 09: Sith collection 3a

body.subject: SW game 09: Sith collection 2a
body.text: SW game 09: Sith collection 2a

body.subject: SW game 09: Sith collection 1a
body.text: SW game 09: Sith collection 1a

body.subject: Soothing Sounds
body.text: I hope you enjoy this ambient sound. I find it very relaxing - my plants also seem to grow more when I play it for them.

body.subject: Hail Cousin!
body.text: Very good Cousin! Best of luck with the initation.

body.subject: SW game 09: Jedi collection 4a
body.text: SW game 09: Jedi collection 4a

body.subject: SW game 09: Jedi collection 3a
body.text: SW game 09: Jedi collection 3a

body.subject: Help with the Flower Patch Module
body.text: To make a Pollenated Bee you need to visit another person's Flower Patch Module and use your Worker Bee on it. You'll get a Pollinated Bee in return! I'll trade you a Flower Patch Module Blueprint for a Worker Bee, if you have one to spare.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Built a Worker Bee. You get the Blueprint to do this from Bee Keeper Bill’s page. If you need help to do this, then ask Henrietta for help.[item]Visit your friends or go to a href="http://mln.lego.com/en-us/Network/Pages.aspx" My LEGO Network Section /a and find a user who has the Flower Patch Module on the Public Page.[item]Use a Worker Bee to win a Pollinated Bee.

body.subject: SW game 09: Jedi collection 1a
body.text: SW game 09: Jedi collection 1a

body.subject: Elevator Music
body.text: I made this up while in the elevator this morning. I grabbed a microphone and recorded as I thought it was kinda catchy. It's the best I could do.

body.subject: Help? Let me see - ohh, I am running late
body.text: I would love to give you a tip, but I have just finished my 5 minute lunch break.[list]Hint[/list][item]Battle Bee Modules and Hive Modules need items in them to run.[item]You can place those items in the Module Editor or by using the Set Up button on your Public View.[item]Once you harvest that module you use up those items - so you'll need more to set it up again.

body.subject: Award
body.text: Congratulation. You got the Right Front Tire in the Racers Game.

body.subject: N/A (no need - no pre req)
body.text: N/A (no need - no pre req)

body.subject: N/A (no need - no pre req)
body.text: N/A (no need - no pre req)

body.subject: Are you the tow guy?
body.text: Where you been? I thought you were supposed to be here five minutes ago? Sorry - no disrespect of nothing there’s just a lot going on right now. I gotta three project sites blocked because of this strange rash of wrecked vehicles. What I need you to do is get in the tow truck and clear the roads. Got it? Good! Do that to collect your Hardhats and you’ll have the LEGO City Rookie Badge in no time. Thanks a million.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Play the LEGO City of The Robots Chronicles Game to earn Hardhats.[item]Trade Forman Frank for the City Rookie Badge Blueprint.[item]Build the Badge.[item]Talk to Seymour Brickstein for more information.

body.subject: Operation Douse Out
body.text: Great. You’re here. Listen, we don’t have much time. Don’t think for a minute Doctor Inferno is actually trying run a racing contest today. Our intel shows that he’s up to no good. So get out there and track down his vehicles. You’ll earn Agent Dossiers - special secret reports. Earn enough of them and you can get yourself an Agent’s Rookie Badge. Over and out.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Play the LEGO Agents of The Robots Chronicles Game to earn Agent Dossiers.[item]Trade Forman Frank for the Agent’s Rookie Badge Blueprint.[item]Build the Badge.[item]Talk to Seymour Brickstein for more information.

body.subject: BIO Code arrival
body.text: Thank you for entering your B.I.O. Code. As a reward, here is a special BIONICLE sticker for you to use in My LEGO Network. Place it into your inventory by clicking the “Collect Attachment” button above, and then you can use it in your Page Builder.[list]Join the Story![/list][item]Bara Magna needs a hero like you! Join me and the other Agori and Glatorians in My LEGO Network by visiting my MLN page a href="http://mln.lego.com/en-us/Network/default.aspx" here /a .

body.subject: BIO Code arrival
body.text: Thank you for entering your B.I.O. Code. As a reward, here is a special BIONICLE sticker for you to use in My LEGO Network. Place it into your inventory by clicking the “Collect Attachment” button above, and then you can use it in your Page Builder.[list]Join the Story![/list][item]Bara Magna needs a hero like you! Join me and the other Agori and Glatorians in My LEGO Network by visiting my MLN page a href="http://mln.lego.com/en-us/Network/default.aspx" here /a .

body.subject: Helper Bee
body.text: If you want to make Honey you've got to get some Pollenated Bees. I think Flora will help you - she's got a great Flower Patch Module that will help you and your friends make the honey you need. I think she'll teach you how to make one for a Worker Bee. Tell her I said "Hi," won't ya? She's so dreamy!

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: Nice - you got the key!
body.text: ”Congratulations! The key to the City – I guess that’s one way to get in. As you know by now I tried a different way! But I don’t hold any grudges, well done you beat me this time and I think you deserve a small break to relax and maybe play some games? – here is a token for you to spend, perhaps you will find a creation of mine out there somewhere… Oh and, before you managed to stop my robot, I left something inside the city, wonder what it is?”[list]Tip[/list][item]Find the secret awards in the game...[item]Have fun with the Arcade Games.[item]Play well!

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: A Sticker for you!
body.text: Here's one from my favorite Sport, Hockey. You know in college I was Goal Keeper Bill!

body.subject: What do we have here?
body.text: Astronaut chair, Badger Skateboard, Castle Turret, Dragon Cage – oh – sorry. Hello! I’m the Brickkeeper. Professor Brickkeeper to be precise. I have the pleasure of being the City’s foremost creativity chronicler. As you may know from visiting my Creation Lab – we’ve got quite the task ahead of us. So why don’t you roll up your sleeves and get building and uploading your creations! Be sure to come to my page and get your Plastic Inductor Module for your very own My LEGO Network page. It can show off all your Creation Lab work and get you some Plastic Pellets too! I’m always in need of those –in fact I’m offering some pretty great trades for them on my page. No time for anymore small talk, I’m afraid! I must get back to work! Talk to you soon!

body.subject: From a simpler time...
body.text: In my old life, my real life I loved to play soccer... Oh well, when this gig is over maybe they'll assign me to role as an undercover soccer player. One can only dream.

body.subject: The Truth is Obvious
body.text: I’m really Rita Blisstow and not Sandy Starreyed. I’m an agent on a mission to recover the Mind Control Emitter. But you already know that. Here... I don't want you wasting this.

body.subject: If you are serious...
body.text: Being an agent takes hard work and dedication. Sandee Starreyed hardly ever gives out her autograph anymore. If you could get one, then I’ll know that you have both.

body.subject: Can the truth be forced? I wonder.
body.text: Ok so you're using that thing on me to make me tell you the truth. But what if my notion of the truth is wrong? Or what if it's right and everyone else is wrong? How true would that be? So here... I just give this one word, do with it as you please, but let's just remember what we mean and we speak about the truth. Here it is: "Zentih"

body.subject: Sums it up nicely...
body.text: If you had to sum up the human experience into one word, this might be high on my list of candidates. All our yearning to know, all of our fears...

body.subject: We Can Help You
body.text: Let's play a little game. What if I'm not real? The "N" by my name indicates I'm not. Furthermore you know I'm not real because I write the same things over again. But... then so do you, correct? How many times have you sent "Gimme a Sticker" while using this Web site? If you were to log into MLN one day and find that you had an "N" next to your Avatar, would you yourself be any less human?

body.subject: Sub Frequencies
body.text: This is from my, well David Lampton's new album. I've encoded some of my native tongue in the lower frequencies. The word "Peace" in Martain. I know... and I'm aware of the irony. Human Ears can't hear it.

body.subject: Sounds like home...
body.text: Now THAT is some great music. It’s so relaxing... It calls me to speak... It’s true my friend... David Lampton is just a character I’m playing to fit in while I study your planet. Keep it under your hat, okay? I know it seems very strange, but I think you are open minded enough to accept it. You should look up my friend Patrick Fate, the writer. He's working on a novel, several novels, about all this.

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: If I’ve learned one thing during my time on this planet, it’s this: No one is exactly who they say they are. Watch your friends carefully, and listen to what they say. Their motivations might surprise you.

body.subject: You kids like this stuff right?
body.text: Skateboards, Pizza, Video Games. Yeah! I'm hip you kids... Right? Right?

body.subject: Double Agent, eh?
body.text: I had no idea you were on our side. Good work, agent. Be careful with this device. If it falls into the wrongs hands, all our plans will be ruined! And I for one can’t stand one more MINUTE of all this awful music! Once we’re finished, we’ll be calling the shots! JP out.

body.subject: Ready for Duty, Sir!
body.text: Sorry Sir. I must have nodded off. I’m so woozy! Let me start again: This is Agent JP, reporting in. I have successfully stolen the mind control machine. These fools have no idea what they’re in for! Unless my orders have changed, I will hand the machine over to the agent who proves they are in possession of the Code Book. We’re almost there, sir!
