Remember me when you take over the world! JP Out.

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: If I could give one piece of advice to all young bands, it’s this: Pace yourself! You have to have some hits before you can go gold, and you better get used to gold before you have a chance at going platinum. Enjoy your music, and make the most of working together with your band. The rest will take care of itself in time.

body.subject: The truth...
body.text: Oh my goodness! I feel so strange, like I’m alone and relaxed for the first time in months. Hey... want to know a secret? Sandee Starreyed isn’t real; I made her up. My real name is Rita Blistow. I’m a Secret Agent on a mission to recover the Mind Control Emitter. Don’t tell anyone, okay?

body.subject: I've seen too many of these...
body.text: Here's a sticker of my touring plane!

body.subject: Price of Stardom
body.text: When you get famous, you have to watch every word you say, because someone is always there to listen. I can’t even imagine what things I’d tell if I didn’t have to worry about other people hearing me.

body.subject: How did you get that sound?
body.text: Now THAT is a crazy sound! You’re REALLY cutting edge! It reminds me of some strange stuff I heard Sandee saying once. Check this out, it’s really out there!

body.subject: Are you a member?
body.text: If you sign up for the free LEGO Club Magazine online you'll can recieve the LEGO Club Magazine Badge, Rank 1. Once you've constructed the badge you can be friends with Max and get cool modules like the ones on 's page!

body.subject: Tape Manipulation
body.text: I've been playing around with loops with Loops... Think it turned out pretty interesting.

body.subject: It’s too dangerous for you here.
body.text: I doth apologize, gentle swain. This field is far too pitched and heated for one such as thyself. Strategies and information changes by the second out here, and if thou are not properly equipped, thou shalt come to harm. Verily, return when thou hast the Brickota Totem Pole, and we shall get you on the winning side!

body.subject: Masks
body.text: I think that artistic expression is nothing less than exposing your very essence into your work. Some times people where masks to help them get at that essence... sometimes people are just pretending to be somebody else for their own gain. Be on the look out for those folks.

body.subject: Thou hast chosen well!
body.text: Thy wisdom shines through in thine choice of allegiances. Verily, as the eldest child I am the worthy heir to my father’s throne, and my brother ignores this truth at his peril. As my newest subject, I task thee to head out onto the field, and do thy part to bring victory to the House of Gauntlets!

body.subject: Thou art breaking up.
body.text: Thou appearest to be a brave and resourceful person…and yet I’m afraid that I am not able to accept thine offer of friendship at this time. Things are out of control over here, and we cannot afford to take someone in we cannot stay in contact with. Please find me again once thou hast completed the Brickota Totem Pole, and we will have room for thee then. I promise.

body.subject: Woah...
body.text: Now THAT is one crazy sound! It’s really new…but it also makes me a bit woozy. Actually, it reminds me of some REALLY crazy stuff I heard Sandee say a while back. Sounds like you might get a kick out of it.

body.subject: This guy is cool!
body.text: Here's a sticker - I think it's really AWESOME! Kinda scary but in a cool way.

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: When a band’s got chemistry, you’ve got to keep working at it if you want to get to the top. Once you start getting noticed, your songs’ll get more and more popular. The hotter the record, the more you can get.

body.subject: Re: I wanna Rock!
body.text: I composed this recently. It might wind up on the sound track to my latest film.

body.subject: Very inspirational...
body.text: Now this is going to make a great song! Thank you for your help. Hey…want to know a secret? I just signed on to play a character named Tommy Marz in a new movie. He’s an alien from another world who comes to Earth. It’s a great way for me to show a different side of my personality…but sometimes I think I’m getting too carried away in the role.

body.subject: From a fan...
body.text: I’m not sure what this is all about, but you’re obviously doing something important. Why don’t you check out this cool artifact that a fan sent me a few months back. I don’t know what it means, but maybe it’ll give you some inspiration for something.

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: In the world of music, it’s hard to go it alone. You have to have a great band by your side if you want to rack up the hit records.

body.subject: Weird Vibes
body.text: Whoa, man! I haven’t felt this out of it since my band finished that thirty-hour jam a few months back. It was super-real, but we were all so zoned afterwards! I remember Sandee started saying some stuff that was WAY out there. I never figured out what she was saying. Maybe you can.

body.subject: Permission to Rock Granted!
body.text: Here's some of my guitar work I threw down this morning. Enjoy.

body.subject: With a little help from your friends...
body.text: To hang in my neck of the woods, you GOTTA feel the music. And the ONLY way to feel the music is to be in a band. Why don’t you gather up some mates and start laying down some tracks? You’ll fit right in around here…and you might even end up with some hits!

body.subject: Nice!
body.text: Great job - you got this far. Now collect your award, build it and it will be shown on your public page. Now befriend the professor, Stanley Brick, and trade for the cool video...

body.subject: I roam alone, my friend
body.text: I truly appreciate your wanting to be my friend. However, for reasons I will not go into here, my destiny requires that I travel alone until the day I hear a tune played on an Enchanted Harp. Until then…please understand.

body.subject: You might not be ready for me yet.
body.text: I’m sorry friend, but I don’t think there’s much I can do for you yet. You know what they say…you have to learn to play acoustic instruments before you can have any success plugging them in. In fact, why don’t you come back when you can play a tune on an Enchanted Harp. That’ll show me that you’re ready for the next step.

body.subject: It’s an honor to know you.
body.text: I’m friends with Seno Evel...YOU’RE friends with Seno Evel…and now you are friends with me! How’s THAT for closing a circuit! Something tells me there are lots of things we can talk about, both from yesterday AND today. Right now I'm working on a new Wi-Fi transmitter - I'd be willing to make you one if you could send me a circuit board. I need them for new synth I'm building to play with Seno next month!

body.subject: If you really want my friendship, it is yours.
body.text: I have not spoken to another person since I left the Brickotas. Since then, I have wandered alone, with no companion by my side. I would understand if you changed your mind and decided to leave me once more…but if you still wish to be my friend, then so it shall be.

body.subject: I am honored by your friendship
body.text: Kind soul, thank you for befriending me and the others here. Please do not be fooled by my age. Though I may be very old, I still have much wisdom to offer to those who would listen, and have earned the right.

body.subject: You are a kind soul
body.text: Hello young warrior. I can tell that you are a serious student, ready to learn all you can from the Brickota people. Always remember that even the strongest warrior cannot rely on muscle alone. Intelligence and cunning will prevail every time.

body.subject: Great to Have you!
body.text: Hello, new friend! We are always happy to welcome kind individuals into our inner circle. And any friend of Izzy’s is a friend of mine! If you’re interested in learning the ways of the Brickota people, the Tribal Elders are always looking to pass on their knowledge. Give them a token of your sincerity, and they’ll accept you.

body.subject: Welcome my Friend
body.text: My daughter has great things to say about you, and so I am proud to count you as my friend. We are a peaceful people, and while we treasure the past, we are always looking for ways to move into the future as well. One day, perhaps I can teach you the wisdom hidden in the rhythmic beating of the tribal drum.

body.subject: Through A Node Darkly...
body.text: Hello, compadre. Congratulations; not everyone can break away from the black iron prison to find their way to me. You are clearly a brave person who can think for yourself. But sometimes I wonder if that’s enough. No matter how hard I deny it, I can’t help but feel as though we’re all being manipulated…as though my whole life if a part of one giant game. Have you ever felt that way? If so, I have a book you have to read. It’ll clarify a lot, but if you want it, you have to send ME something clear too.

body.subject: Do you Accept the Mission?
body.text: I’m glad you’re my friend now, because I need your help. We were having a jam session at Rick Moon’s place when, as Sandy Starreyed, I started singing the secret passwords from her code book instead of her lyrics. I’m suspicious that JP Variety has the Mind Control Emitter and was trying to get me to reveal the secret code. Please go build some Hypnotic Frequency Machines and send them to JP and the members of David Lampton’s band to see what you can learn.

body.subject: Ambush!
body.text: {Sender} has a Dino Ambush on their page! Watch Out!

body.subject: Ambush!
body.text: {Sender} had a Dino Ambush on thier page! Watch Out!

body.subject: Coming in at Number 1 This Week
body.text: {Sender}'s Solo Perfomance Module sends you these new sounds!

body.subject: Coming in at Number 5 This Week!
body.text: {Sender}'s Solo Perfomance Module sends you these new sounds!

body.subject: Slow Down There, My Friend!
body.text: You’ve got me puzzled! I am most grateful for these red bricks you sent me, but I must say it wouldn’t be right for me to take them. We already made this trade, and you already got the blueprint for the Lego Tree Module. Simply head on over to your inventory, you’ll be able to make as many trees as you want. Plant them on your page, and you’ll start growing more red bricks than you’ll know what to do with. If you’re still looking for something to do with these bricks, why don’t you drop by my friend Henrietta’s page. She’s been asking for some apples, and I haven’t got any to spare. Ask for the blueprint for mason jars. Those things are just great for us farmers.[list]Hint[/list][item]You only need 1 Blueprint to make as many Modules as you like.[item]Collect your 25 Red LEGO Bricks and go to your Inventory to build your LEGO Tree Module.[item]Go to Page Builder to add the LEGO Tree Module to your Public Page.

body.subject: I think I can trust you
body.text: Hey there. Thanks for being my pal. I’m sorry if I seemed a little standoffish at first, but it’s hard for me to know who wants to be my friend, and who’s just looking for an autograph. You wouldn’t know it based on what I do, but I’m really a very quiet person in real life. In fact, sometimes, you can’t even hear me onstage. It’s a problem for me, and it’s only going to get worse now that I’ve decided to add some brass instruments to my band.

body.subject: Try my Fan Club instead
body.text: Dear David Lampton Fan, Thank you for your interest in becoming David Lampton’s friend. We are sorry to say that he is unable to fulfill your request at this time. Mr. Lampton has many fans, and while his house is quite big, it’s not large enough to accommodate all of the people who want to crash there. Please write us again once you have your own Craftsman Cottage. Keep Rocking!

body.subject: Acceptance Granted
body.text: I accept your offer of friendship. It is granted. You may now proceed on in your task. In as much as I can understand human emotion, I wish you success.

body.subject: You are the kindest person in the world!
body.text: Thank you SOOOO much for being my friend! Such generosity of spirit is found only the very greatest of people. I just know that we’re going to get along great! In fact, you’re already my best friend in the universe!

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: This is an automated response. I will be out of the office for next few days sorting a shipment of miniature elephants. Who knew you could shrink them down to pocket sized? For help with My LEGO Network please see Echo or stop by my LEGO Universe Creation Lab to see me in person. Thanks! Prof. Brickkeeper

body.subject: System Error F321
body.text: You have requested a connection to this robot as a friend. This is an unauthorized attempt constituting a fatal error. Connection requires Intergalactic Cruiser for acceptance. If this problem persists, please restart the program or see an administrator for further details.

body.subject: Re: Gimme a Sticker!
body.text: I think you'll find this little specimen from LEGO Universe quite interesting! Oh that reminds me I've got to get back to labeling my insect collection. Talk later!

body.subject: BFF!
body.text: {Sender} has a BFF! And friendship has it's privledges!

body.subject: Great to see you out here!
body.text: Be proud, Earthling! VERY few people make it all the way to me, even if they’ve heard my name. In fact, since you’ve made it this far…maybe you’d be willing to help me with something. A friend left an egg with me before she left on a journey, and I’m afraid I’m just no good at this sort of thing. Please though, don’t agree to this unless you’re REALLY committed to it. Martian eggs are notoriously finicky, and only the most determined of beings can get them to hatch.

body.subject: …….static………..too great…….
body.text: Hey ....orker. . .m im……d th.. .o. …nd me, beca… few people c... Ho….r, the sta… .s t.. …at for th.. to contin.. m..h lo.ge. Perh… if y.. p.rf..t s.ac. ..avel wi.. an Inter..lact.c Cru..er, we cou.. ..eak furt... .ood luc..

body.subject: I sense great things from you.
body.text: My gift grants me the ability to see things that go unnoticed by many…but the potential in you is obvious to all. It is clear that you are exactly what Fleet Command needs to grow and prosper. Now go and take the steps necessary to become the success here that you are destined to be.

body.subject: Your mind is not yet focused
body.text: Yours is a rare intellect, and it is clear to me that Fleet Command needs you…and yet I sense that your mind is still conflicted with other tasks. You must be free of other thoughts when you work here. I suggest you finish your other tasks…including the Tower of Many Shields…and then come back to us.

body.subject: Looking for Help? Go see Bee Keeper Bill.
body.text: Go see my friend Bee Keeper Bill. He's my source for the honey I use to make my special Honey Pie. He's got some great trades on his page![list]Hint[/list][item]Have you traded with Henrietta yet? You need the Mason Jar Blueprint to be able to get the Worker Bee Blueprint from Bee Keeper Bill’s page.

body.subject: Re: I wanna Rock!
body.text: Well... I'm not much for the rock music. But I do enjoy to listen to classical piano playing while I cook. Maybe you'll enjoy this:

body.subject: A Sticker for you
body.text: I hope you enjoy this sticker... It's kind of "Pop Art" don't you think? Take care.[list]Creative hint[/list][item]Collect this Sticker and go to your Page Builder and drag a Sticker Module to the page. Now make your very own Sticker design and show it to your friends. Just so you know - some of the Stickers unlock exclusive Sticker Backgrounds.

body.subject: I agree..
body.text: You're work does show a lot of potential! Keep up the creativity. Ciao!

body.subject: Help with Gallery and Factory Modules
body.text: In order to get a photo or LXF file up on your Gallery or Factory module you must first have that file uploaded and approved to a gallery on LEGO.com. There are all sorts galleries on LEGO.com from Creator to BIONCICLE – so you have lots to choose from. Once you have your model or photo approved you can drag it into your Gallery or Factory module as you would with a Sticker. Hit Save on the Module, save on the page – and presto! You are now on your way to becoming a great photographer – who knows, maybe some day your work will hang in my gallery here in New York City! If you want to learn more about taking great pictures head over to the Creator design school – they have some excellent tips on photographing your model.[list]Hint[/list][item]If you want to get Red LEGO Bricks much faster than with the standard LEGO Tree Module, then try to mail F Stop Clikzgerald an Apple and see what happens.

body.subject: Long Live Imagination!
body.text: The heroic images from {Sender}'s Quixotic Gallery Module have inspired this small gift. It's a tale of noble knights and heroic deeds. I bet you know somebody who could really enjoy an uplifting story like this.

body.subject: You've recieved a gift from {Sender}'s Pet Water Bug!
body.text: A Gift from a Pet Water Bug!

body.subject: Dig this!
body.text: While digging at {Sender}'s Dinosaur Excavation Module you unearth this amazing gem!

body.subject: Thanks for the Apple!
body.text: Thanks for the Apple! I’ll make a Still Life Model before I eat it! I noticed your gallery module is a little "simplistic" for my tastes. Here take this Blueprint, it can teach you to make a much better Gallery Module. You can construct the Gallery Module with your Inventory and then place it on your page with the Page Builder. Ciao![list]Hint[/list]When you have uploaded your photo or model to a gallery, LEGO needs to approve it, before it gets visible and you can use it in My LEGO Network. br Once you have your model or photo approved, you can go to your Page Builder and choose a Gallery or Factory Module by dragging it to your page. Here you can drag it as you would in the Sticker Module. Hit Save on the Module, Save on the page – and presto!

body.subject: You've recieved a gift from {Sender}'s Pet Ball Lightning!
body.text: A Gift from Pet Ball Lightning

body.subject: Delivery Malfunction!
body.text: Wow! {Sender}'s Merchobot has sent it's tires to wrong address... again! You might want to trade or share these with your friends.

body.subject: Farm Pet Sounds
body.text: Straight from the farm! {Sender}'s is treating you to this country-fresh loop!

body.subject: Farm Fresh!
body.text: Straight from the farm! {Sender}'s is treating you to this country-fresh pack of strawberries!

body.subject: Treason Beavers report their mission completed.
body.text: Treason Beavers have bursted through {Sender}'s Electro-Dam and look what the flood has brought in!

body.subject: A gift from a Pet Dinosaur!
body.text: {Sender}'s pet Dinosaur has a special gift for you!

body.subject: Will you join the fray?
body.text: Welcome to the winning side, worthy soldier! Verily, I offer you my hand in friendship, and my sword in battle. If thou are not yet properly armed for battle, then I beseech you to correct this problem post haste. The dragons can’t do it alone!

body.subject: Having trouble, are we?
body.text: Well – it’s not rocket science. Actually. Nevermind. It’s simple – choose the path of hard work and pay me for the crystal by trading me on my page. Or mail me a space fuel cell for a more interesting approach.

body.subject: Are you a member?
body.text: If you sign up for the free LEGO Club Magazine online you'll can recieve the LEGO Club Magazine Badge, Rank 1. Once you've constructed the badge you can be friends with Max and get cool modules like the ones on Sender 's page!

body.subject: You did it!
body.text: Congratulations! You’ve recovered the Stolen Plans. I can’t imagine this was a very easy job. Well – I think you’ve proved yourself to be quite the hero. Star Justice could use somebody like you. Take this badge and wear it proudly – you’ve earned it!

body.subject: I don't get it.
body.text: I don't understand the mail you sent me. I'm sorry, us Networkers can only make sense of certain mails and attachments. But keep trying, we often give you a hint to what items and mails we're looking for on our page.

body.subject: You have a problem?
body.text: Well I’m here to help, don’t panic! First just trade me 10 Blue bricks for a Space Fuel Plant Gallery Module. You can do this by finding the trade module on my page and simply clicking it. Once you get your first couple of Space Fuel Cells, just mail me one. We’ll take it from there. If you don’t have any Blue LEGO Bricks yet, try getting to Rank 2 or 3 in My LEGO Network. There’s plenty of help for getting there from folks like Echo, Bartlebee and Don Brickote.

body.subject: This here is from our latest mission!
body.text: I’ve looked through my scrapbook and picked you one of the latest and greatest spacecraft in the Star Justice fleet. Hope you enjoy!

body.subject: This one reminds me of my first space raid…
body.text: Oh to be young again… Remind me to show you some of my baby pictures. I was known to be quite the larva!

body.subject: It burns clean!
body.text: Great job with this. This fuel tested off the charts in terms of quality. Ok, here’s what you do next. Keep growing those Space Fuel Cells, you’ll need them to build Space Probes. You can use them on other people’s Space Probe Mission Module for chance to get Bob Skull’s Coordinates – or you can build your own Space Probe Mission Module by trading me for the blueprint on my page. Once you have Bob Skull’s Coordinates you can go befriend him to begin the “negation” to get back those stolen plans! Do what it takes! When you’ve got the Stolen Data Crystal from him, mail it to me and I’ll get you a very special badge for your hard work. Oh, if can’t find Bob Skull listed anywhere – just type in his name “Bob Skull” in the search for user box on any public page.

body.subject: Incomplete Circuit
body.text: Sorry. We can't be corresponding quite yet. I'm sure you heard, that Bur O Crat is laying down the law with us contractors.... Just get to Rank 5 and come back and then he can't say nothing!

body.subject: Rocking!
body.text: So glad you want to learn to be an Electrician. I started this journey because I was interested in making my own electric guitars - then I started to be into the trade and the science behind it. It wasn't too long before I started to see everything, the whole world, as one big circuit. Crazy stuff. Phew! Back to reality - In order for me to get you started just send me a Form 20B. Yep. You guessed it, Bur O Crat's rule.

body.subject: That was fast!!!
body.text: Thank you so much for your fast reply - I want you as my co-driver any day. Pick up these Racing Trophies and get a head start in The Robot Chronicles.

body.subject: That was fast!!!
body.text: Thank you so much for your fast reply - I want you as my co-driver any day. Pick up these Racing Trophies and get a head start in The Robot Chronicles.

body.subject: That was fast!!!
body.text: Thank you so much for your fast reply - I want you as my co-driver any day. Pick up these Racing Trophies and get a head start in The Robot Chronicles.

body.subject: That was fast!!!
body.text: Thank you so much for your fast reply - I want you as my co-driver any day. Pick up these Racing Trophies and get a head start in The Robot Chronicles.

body.subject: Well good for you…
body.text: You’ve tracked me down. Goodie for you. I’m sure you’re about ready to haul me into to Star Justice. But, you know, you must have some smarts to have located me, I think with a mind like that you could see the “bigger picture,” couldn’t you? If you want to go on doing all the hard work for Capt Reynolds by all means – you can have the data crystal back. It’s available on my page for the hefty sum of 100 Space Fuel Cells. But I ask you – why should a person of your talent work so hard, while Star Justice simply sits on their helm chairs eating dehydrated ice cream? There is another way. Why don’t you mail me one of those Space Fuel Cells and I’ll get your started on a more… lucrative path.

body.subject: Mission closed
body.text: [list]Mission closed[/list][item]Sorry, we have decided to close this mission.[item]But don't worry, there are many other missions that await you.[item]Check out the Homepage to find other adventures.[item]Play well!

body.subject: If you stop and think the answer is obvious.
body.text: Use your Dino's on other people's Dino Grazing Modules. You must spend Green Bricks to get a chance to win Dino Scales.

body.subject: A wild specimen
body.text: Now I don't know which I like better, battling these vicious guys or studying them. My job demands both. Yes, I know. I have the best job in the world.

body.subject: Welcome to Star Justice!
body.text: Great to have you onboard. So are you ready for your first mission? Ok. Here it goes. I’m sure by now you’ve heard of those despicable space marauders – the Space Skulls. Yes? Well a particularly nasty member of the Space Skulls, a space sleaze by the name of Bob Skull, has stolen a Data Crystal with some of our new G Class Space Cruiser plans. We need to get those plans back! Problem is, he’s so tucked away in an asteroid belt that we can’t pinpoint his location. We’ll need you to go and find his location and get that Data Crystal back. But hang on there, buckaroo, before you go mounting up, we need to make sure you’re ready for this. Why don’t you start by making sure you got yourself a space fuel source – you’ll need a lot of space fuel to complete this mission. You can find the blueprint to build your own plant on my page. Send me a sample when you’re up and producing Space Fuel and I’ll get you onto the next part of your mission.

body.subject: Mission closed
body.text: [list]Mission closed[/list][item]Sorry, we have decided to close this mission.[item]But don't worry, there are many other missions that await you.[item]Check out the Homepage to find other adventures.[item]Play well!

body.subject: Striking out on your own?
body.text: Yes. I like your style – you’ve impressed me. First tracking me down in the middle of this forsaken asteroid belt – and now having the slippery morals to ponder abandoning your mission. You’re my kinda guy. Well if you want to forget about Star Justice and join me instead just build this Interstellar Ambush. You’ll trick your friends and their Space Probes will be taken off course with no chance of finding me. Show me you can do this by trading me your Lost Space Probes on my page and I’ll get you into Space Skulls. But be warned – you won’t be able to complete your mission with Captain Reynolds – not that it seems to matter much to you anymore.

body.subject: A Home for Lost Letters
body.text: You know if you reply it will just go in the pile I'm afraid.

body.subject: I'm Sorry
body.text: I can't be your friend

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: Well, I'm not much for teaching. Maybe go see Dr. Killroy?

body.subject: One for your collection
body.text: Here's a sticker you might like. It's our very own Dino Buggy!

body.subject: Not quite yet!
body.text: Sorry. You're not ready to be my friend. Please come back when you are Rank 2.

body.subject: Fight the System!
body.text: I’m sorry to say this, my friend, but my circle of friends are all rebels. If we’re seen hanging around with someone who hasn’t broken away from the mainstream, then we’ll lose all are cred on the scene. Hit me up again when you get a cottage of your own. Then I’ll know you’re ready for us.

body.subject: I am SOOOOOO Sorry!!!
body.text: Oh NO! I BADLY want to be your friend, and I SO hope you understand this and don’t get mad…but I’m not allowed to accept you yet! You have to have the Intergalactic Cruiser first! Please come back when you have one. Please!!

body.subject: Coming in at Number 12 This Week!
body.text: {Sender}'s Solo Perfomance Module sends you these new sounds!

body.subject: Coming in at Number 20 this week!
body.text: {Sender}'s Solo Perfomance Module sends you these new sounds!

body.subject: I don't get it.
body.text: Ha ha ha ha ha! You are SO funny!! I don’t understand what you just said to me…but it must be a great joke that I just don’t get! Please don’t be mad! We can still be friends…right?

body.subject: Runtime Error
body.text: Your message does not compute. Please check your data, and try again. If the problem persists, please restart the program or see an administrator for further details.

body.subject: What are you...ZZZZTTTZZ... trying to say?
body.text: Sorry. I don’t understand - ZZZTZZZTZ - what this is all about. Don’t be offended. I don’t mean any harm. If you have to leave now, I won’t - ZZTZTZTZZ - blame you.

body.subject: Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi Hi
body.text: I don’t don’t don’t don’t understand understand! This isn’t for for for for me me me! Have fun fun fun fun fun fun fun fun on MyLEGO!

body.subject: I don’t know what this is about, but I’m sure you’re looking for Echo, not me. No one ever wants to talk to me... anymore.
body.text: Hi hi... Oh I'm not doing this!

body.subject: My old friends...
body.text: It has been too long since my beam gazed upon my old friends, the galant riders from long ago... I miss them greatly. But you - you seem to share their thirst for knowledge and wonderous creativity. Thank you for being my friend.

body.subject: Dream Beam
body.text: The Dreaming Beam Infuser is one of the most powerful tools in the My LEGO Network, and I am certain that it will be of great service to you. All you need is the blueprint, and the access codes. The access codes can be found from the discarded welcome robots. They have strange names and will be hard to find. You'll need to work with your friends to track them down and share the knowledge.

body.subject: Rattle your speakers
body.text: This sound is very deep. Like the waters of my home world.

body.subject: You'll need a lot of help
body.text: An alien egg needs a great deal of care and attention. In fact, the job might be too big for one person. Be sure to enlist help if you want it to hatch.

body.subject: Some music I thought up
body.text: Plugging into my neural net I just put a conversion to my mind's own Theta waves to output a frequency. It sounds like music I think!

body.subject: Prospects look good.
body.text: I am proof that the link between humanity and machinery is possible. This Intergalactic Cruiser that Fleet Academy is building is going to need both, working together, to accomplish its mission. Keep that, and me, in mind as you move forward.

body.subject: Sounds of my homeland
body.text: I hope you enjoy this Flatarecki Folk Song.

body.subject: Don't put all your trust in machines alone...
body.text: Computers are forever growing in complexity and potential... but never underestimate the power of the living mind. In order for this mission to succeed, both must work in perfect harmony.

body.subject: Commander Hobolt taught me a song. If you'd like I can sing it for you.
body.text: Daisy, Daisy, give me your answer - do! I'm half crazy over the love of you.

body.subject: This conversation will serve no purpose.
body.text: I'm sorry {Recipient}, I'm afraid I can't do that.

body.subject: I understand how this looks, but I think you should just calm down.
body.text: I need to tell you this {Recipient}. Building an Intergalactic Cruiser is hard work I am told, and there have been many before you who have been discouraged. But I've still got the greatest enthusiasm and confidence in the mission. And I want to help you. Keep at it, and if ever I can help you with a trade, do not hesitate to ask.
O.o ?

body.subject: Be on the look out...
body.text: You know, in deep space sometimes the boundaries between fiction and reality get a little blurry. Just last week my son showed me this battle machine in his EXO-FORCE comic book. Wouldn't you know it - not 5 chronons later were we battling something just like on on the surface of Krath 8. The coloring was different - but pretty much the same design. Strange worlds we live in.

body.subject: Re: Rocks
body.text: ... Rock eh? Let's see, Igneous, Sedimentary, Metamorphic... I've got a large collection of... oh, I see, like the music? Well I have some wonderful sound files I've collected from LEGO Universe! How about this?

body.subject: Ready for the ultimate challenge?
body.text: If you think you’ve got what it takes, I can get you a blueprint for an Intergalactic Cruiser. But be prepared: it calls for many things, and even those are hard to make. Don’t get discouraged, and keep at it!

body.subject: Rock music is a little bit much when you are traveling at light speed
body.text: When flying at light speed, I prefer to put on my slippers, play some Jazz over the ships intercom and just relax. Hyggelig! Oh sorry - that's Danish for cozy.

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: I’m not going to lie to you…working for Fleet Command is pretty special, and once people get here, they like to show off. If you choose to re-design your page with space-themed modules, everyone here would understand!

body.subject: Perhaps a touch of savagery might do
body.text: Ah, such bold expression! Though I am now enlightened, there comes a time, dare I say, for every monkey to rock out!

body.subject: Re: Help!
body.text: Just as the Great Wall of China was begun with a single brick, so too can the same thing be said for building a craft fit for space travel. Though the task may seem daunting, keep at it. And just like with the Great Wall…start with some very special bricks.

body.subject: A mission awaits you!
body.text: Hi, I’m Captain Reynolds from Star Justice! Are you ready to blast off? Then simply collect this attached badge and come add me as a friend to begin your LEGO Factory Space mission!

body.subject: Warning!
body.text: Working for the Space Skulls! Can it be true? {Sender} is working for the Space Skulls? I would look out for {Sender}’s Space Probe Mission Modules if I were you. It might be a trap!

body.subject: Welcome on board!
body.text: Nice badge – great to meet you in person. You did well, but please continue to help – there are more people to rescue and more badges to be won![list]Hint[/list][item]Did you know that you can buy cool stickers from Old Capt Joe and a lot of other Networkers as well. You can also send the Networkers on your Friend List a mail with the right message to get stickers. Remember that certain Stickers unlock exclusive Sticker backgrounds.

body.subject: I am looking for some real heroes.
body.text: Sorry, you need to prove yourself before I can be seen together with you. Go to the LEGO CITY website and prove yourself in the LEGO CITY Coast Guard Game. Beat the first level and create a badge, and I might reconsider.

body.subject: Bummer!
body.text: Scientifically speaking, I'm bummed you won't be befriending my buddies from LEGO Universe when they become networkers! Our fun-o-meters won't detect nearly as many good times without you! Let's see, what was that other thing?... Right! Of course! Thank you for answering the question!

body.subject: Stupendous!
body.text: So glad you'll befriend my buddies from LEGO Universe when they become networkers! The chances of our fun-o-meters detecting good times are-- let's see here... terrific! Now, what was that other thing?... Right! Of course! Thank you for answering the question!

body.subject: Pensive Piano
body.text: Late I night I play the piano. I find it helps me think. I hope it brings you some joy.

body.subject: The Kingdom will be ours!
body.text: Thou hast chosen sides wisely. My sister and her pathetic army are a blight on this great land. Once I take control of the kingdom, I shall see to it that she is banished forever. Until that day, we must continue to prepare for battle.

body.subject: Courtly Music
body.text: Here is some chamber music for you to add to your collection.

body.subject: Can you rock out on the Tuba?
body.text: Sometimes when I'm working off in the LEGO Tree fields I bring me tuba for a laugh, and to scare off some of them vermin who eat me Red LEGO Bricks. Here's a bit of me playing for your Loop collection. It's not quite "rock" but it could mix in with lots of different sounds - you can make music of all sorts with your Soundtrack Module. Cheers!

body.subject: My last job...
body.text: My last job was captain on this vessel... I was a tough but fair boss, only tossed a few men overboard.

body.subject: Lovely Pie Mate
body.text: Thank-you Mate, that’s the best pie I’ve had all day! You're getting quite good at building here at My LEGO Network, perhaps you are ready for your first Masterpiece. When you build this you will become Rank 1. You are well on your way! Cheers.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Collect the Crimson Apple Masterpiece Blueprint.[item]Go to your Inventory.[item]Construct your first Masterpiece.

body.subject: Re: Building
body.text: I love building too! Too! Well I guess that's pretty obvious since I live on LEGO.com. Hey! Hey! If you wanna take a great picture of your LEGO models, you should stop by my friend F. Stop Clikzgerald's page. He knows all about photography and Gallery Modules.

body.subject: Re: Trading
body.text: Networkers will usually hint at what they are seeking to trade for, but I won't be so subtle. I would love an Apple right about now - I'll trade you one for an Apple Pie Blueprint. Also be sure to check their trade modules on their public pages.

body.subject: Stroke!
body.text: Sailing the high seas in rig like this, that's the life!

body.subject: Dragons, Pft.
body.text: Those fiends in the House of Gauntlets have begun using dragons against us, but luckily, we have recruited stone golems to our cause. The golems should be more than a match for those flying lizards!

body.subject: Re: Gimme a Sticker!
body.text: You're getting the hang of this! This! Here's a sticker:

body.subject: A tale of woe.
body.text: You've forced my hand with this magical device. I must now tell you the truth, though it pains me greatly to confess it. This terrible battle between Pelle and Cynthia is all my fault. For you see, I am their father. Yes, I am the rightful King. The real Wallus Wizzard made me a bet that if left to my heirs, my Kingdom would collaspe. Of course, for both my own honor and the honor of my family name I accepted his bet, believing that my son and daughter could easily run things. But, alas, they have taken up arms against each other. I am cursed by Wallus to serve, in magically sealed silence, in his place as court wizard - until they can work out who among them is the true heir to the throne. I just hope there is still a kingdom around by then...

body.subject: A hidden sorrow...
body.text: This music conjures for my hidden sorrow... If only I could tell you the truth. Carry on then.

body.subject: Let the transmutations begin!
body.text: Use this Transmuting Pool Module to create Grey LEGO Bricks with the help of a member of the House of Gauntlets. Perhaps by working together you'll see that this short sighted battle is not nessecary.

body.subject: Let the transmutations begin!
body.text: Use this Transmutation Pool Module to work together with a member of the House of Mantles. You'll both benefit, I swear this to you. Perhaps when you work together you'll see there's no need for this costly battle.

body.subject: This battle will go on forever!
body.text: Both sides in this conflict seem perfectly matched. From my perch atop my tower, I can see no possible way that either could prevail. Send me a Victory Banner, from either side, I'll teach you to make a Transmuting Pool Module. Perhaps by working together to make Grey LEGO Bricks, the House of Mantles and the House of Gauntlets will realize they aren't so different after all!

body.subject: Ringing of the Bells
body.text: May these sounds bring you comfort.

body.subject: Close
body.text: Hmm… Are you sure you read the P.O.S. charter? Should be a potted plant for first contact.

body.subject: Going all the way, eh? Well, it's your choice.
body.text: Ok kiddo. Sigh. I thought you would listen but I guess not. Here you go, this Ambush will get you those Dino Horns you need. I just gotta ask. Was it worth it?

body.subject: Really? You didn't strike me as the type.
body.text: Ok kiddo - here's how this is going to go down. This Ambush Module will look like the regular Dino Grazing Module - but it actually just steals your guests' Green LEGO Bricks and gives you a Dino Fang. Now listen to this next part... It's REALLY IMPORTANT! Ambushing seems a lot easier then just grazing, but it comes with the risk that people will not like you Ambushing them - they may not want to be your friend anymore. If I was you I would just stop right here and get back to an honest day's work. But... the choice is yours. If you end up wanting to go further, send me an Engine and I'll get you moving up in the Dino Ambush world.

body.subject: Really? Ok... It's your good name.
body.text: Alright... I didn't think you would keep going this way. But here you go. This version of the Ambush Module has an even higher chance of sending out a warning about you. So, it's your choice... But I would stop now if I was you. It's your choice - send me a Dino Fang and I'll get you the highest rank Ambush Module.

body.subject: Yes - me happy!
body.text: Me has all kinds of Tokens. Come see me page! You have good Arcade game time!

body.subject: Me say yes!
body.text: Me and brother make good trades for Tokens. We has lots! You come to page and see.

body.subject: In Section C, Page 21, Paragraph 2...
body.text: ... You'll note the following "Neither the party shall, shall enter into or agree upon friendlist contract until said applicant", that being you, "shall achieve the rank 5 and status of owner of said Jeweled Triceratops Masterpiece." So, I shall speaking with you then, and then only. Good Day.

body.subject: Just fill out these forms... in triplicate
body.text: Sign here. Initial there, and there, and there.... and there. Good. Now we can enter into the contract of friendship. On to business. It seems during your excavation for the Jeweled Triceratops you neglected to aquire a permit to dig. I regret to inform you that you must pay the fee on my page's trade module for the amount of 30 Green LEGO Bricks. You can take your proof of payment to Connie Crete and she will gladly provide you with the means to create Orange LEGO Bricks. You'll need quite a few of those to get Form 20B, which you'll need to do any construction on your next masterpiece. Good Day.

body.subject: I'm sorry young mortal
body.text: The knowledge you seek must sprout from within you first. I bare no seed for those who are not initated. I bare no fruits for those who are not in bloom.

body.subject: Not yet.
body.text: I'm sorry... I can not extend my knowledge to you yet. Come back after you have made the Speedy Motorcycle.

body.subject: Hello Cousin
body.text: Thank you for your kind offer of friendship. Please feel free to use my trade modules to get the blueprints you need to create Green and Purple bricks. I gathered those rare plants from my travels around the world with Dr. Killroy. It brings me great joy to share them with you. I love all plants, even the most common flower or house plant.

body.subject: Finding me is only the start of your journey.
body.text: Wonderful work cousin. You have found me. Send me what you have sent to my followers and I will provide you with the knowledge to bind the seal fragments and join us as a member of the Phantom Orchid Society.

body.subject: Yeah - I'm with ya.
body.text: Hey kiddo. Thanks for adding me to your friendlist. Listen, not sure if you've been collecting Dino Scales yet. Tough work, right? Well what if I were tell you there was an easier way? It's not without risks though... Send me a Dino Scale and I'll hook you up.

body.subject: Right then, I'm off!
body.text: Great! Now I can fix my carbon isotope calibrator, which will help us find traces of the Jeweled Triceratops. You better get going gathering Dino Scales. Here, take this grazing module, this will allow you to host a grazing spot for your friends dinos on your page. They'll leave their scales behind. With those scales you can build bigger and better dinos! Ta Ta!

body.subject: A+ Work.
body.text: Wow, what a fine specimen! What I'd like you to notice is how you can build plant eating dinos with these Dino Scales. While the meat eating dinos require Dino Fangs. Interesting, right? I’m sure you can put the attached Blueprint to good use. It got me through grad school.

body.subject: Not bad. Not bad at all.
body.text: Yeah! Nice dino wrangling. Just what I needed! Hope this blueprint helps you bring in plenty of Green LEGO Brick for you. Cheers! Viper.

body.subject: Well Alright!
body.text: Yehaw! Thanks buddy! Here's how you set up your very own stunt track!

body.subject: Thank you
body.text: Very good Cousin! Best of luck with the initation!

body.subject: A Tire for a Carburetor
body.text: Great! Thanks for the trade. Hey - you wouldn't happen to have an extra Engine you would want to trade would you? I have a blueprint you will really enjoy!

body.subject: A good student
body.text: You know, I got my start as a paleontologist when studying under Dr. Killroy. Who knows, with some academic focus, and a brave heart perhaps you could be my next star student? Here's your first assignment. Bring a Dino Scale to me and I'll teach you how to make the Dino Bone Sticker Module. That should help you very much during your time with the Dino Attack team.

body.subject: Welcome my young friend!
body.text: So nice of you to look me up! Well, I hate to be a bother straight off, but would you care to help me out with a little pickle I find myself in? You see I'm conducting a large expedition to track down an elusive treasure buried in the depths of My LEGO Network. It's called the Jeweled Triceratops and I think I may have tracked down the very spot where it... Wait a minute! You're looking for the very same beast? Splendid! Ok, here's what I need, a Solar Power Cell to fix my carbon isotope calibrator. If you get me that I can teach you how to build the Dino Grazing Module. Be sure to get The Dinosaur Excavation Module from my page while you're at it. This will allow us to begin our dig! I'm so very glad to have met you, a true kindred spirit!

body.subject: Now you are in charge!
body.text: With this badge you have proven to everybody that you are a true member of the Coast Guard. Nobody will ever question your abilities on the wild waters again! Great job! Check out this special sticker - only the very few will get this!

body.subject: Recruit – get back out there!
body.text: Congratulation! But this isn’t enough – there are still people waiting to be rescued…[list]Hint[/list][item]There are a lot of other levels to complete in LEGO City Coast Guard game - a href="http://city.lego.com/en-US/games/coastguard.aspx" click here /a to go back to the game.

body.subject: Secrets of the Great Discs
body.text: Like you I have been through many changes: Matoran, Toa, and now Turaga. But with each change my heart remains strong as the rock beneath my feet. I can see that you too are a hero of great vision and power who has followed the tale of the Toa for many a year. Take this Kanoka Club badge and show your great loyalty and courage to whoever crosses your page. Stay strong, stay vigilant.

body.subject: Nice One
body.text: Yeah man. That's the stuff. So, I'm sending a plan to build your own car. See if you can handle it. Peace brohan!

body.subject: Oh this little guy is great!
body.text: Perfect. I'll have my tools up on shelves so they don't get mixed up with junk in the scrap yard. Thanks! I've attached some plans for my homemade Sticker Module. It's pretty great if I don't say so myself. Oh, by the way... I just found a Muffler and it's in good shape. I'll trade you it for a Tire. Deal?

body.subject: Totally what I needed!
body.text: This guy will totally like help me building and junk. Unlike that weirdo Treason Beaver I made myself. I think it like turned against me cause I was giving him advise on like how to build his house and stuff. I was all totally cool but then he like covered his little Beaver ears or ear holes or whatever they call them, what do I know I'm not a zoologist or whatever studies Beavers, critterologist? No, that doesn't sound right. Maybe I should have become one though whatever it is, oh what was I saying? LOL! Oh, right, ok, he covered his ears and storming off and started tearing down the dam, instead of building it. Weird! Ok well here's how you make one. Later!

body.subject: Just what I needed!
body.text: Fantastic! I was just telling Milly I needed one of these. Here's something for you.

body.subject: The top Coast Guard award!
body.text: WOW! You made it to the top! Admiral is the higest rank within the Coast Guard! Great work, matey - eh, sorry... Mr. Admiral!

body.subject: Great job!
body.text: Hey champ, I never imagined that you would make such a great Coast Guard crew member! Way to go... Captain! Build it and a href="http://city.lego.com/en-US/games/coastguard.aspx" get back /a and try to defeat the final level!

body.subject: Rank 3 - way to go!
body.text: Hay, you are getting good! Almost as good as me now! Build it and get a href="http://city.lego.com/en-US/games/coastguard.aspx" back to the game /a !

body.subject: Award from the sea!
body.text: Congratulations - you won the rank 2 award! Hurry up and build it, then get a href="http://city.lego.com/en-US/games/coastguard.aspx" back to the game /a and rescue some more people!

body.subject: Thank you!
body.text: Thanks a bunch! That’s Yummy! Here’s something to improve your Bees. Long live the Hive Queen!

body.subject: Great job!
body.text: Congratulations - You completed the first level. Now collect these items, go to your Inventory and build your badge. This will be visible on your public page. From then on, hurry back to the game and try to achieve the next badge. Good luck![list]Hint[/list][item]When you have made your first badge you can also be friend with Old Capt Joe and collect cool stickers from LEGO City Coast Guard. Click on his picture in this mail to go to Old Capt Joe's page.

body.subject: Some weird stuff I noticed
body.text: So, I wanted to tell somebody about some of the weird creatures I've noticed around the construction site. They are all helpful... but not exactly what I'm used to. I found this Ball Lightening on one job, said he'd been hanging around since the turn of the century some photographer and his little girl. Yes, this Ball Lightening talks. And Connie has some weird Golem helping her out with the foundation. And Dip he's like talking to roaches now. Just weird. And I thought I was supposed to be the freaky one of the group!

body.subject: I think you finally asked the right person!
body.text: The rock, as promised.

body.subject: Wired
body.text: Yeah man! Nice one. I'm real proud of you. Ok, well, if you have the Blueprint from Ron Roofer, I think you know what to do. Just combine this Electrical System with the rest of the Cottage substructures and you'll be on your way.

body.subject: Don't want to be a stick in the mud
body.text: Hey, I know, I'm not a big fan of rules either. But with electricity, you have to know what you're doing. It's really important. So, I'm glad you are following the protocol. This module will help get you your Electrician's License, turn that back to the old grump, Bur O Crat, and he'll get you the proper permit. Come back when you got it, ok? Hang in there.

body.subject: What?
body.text: I can't hear you. Wait let me shut this off. You want what now?

body.subject: Rock?
body.text: I'm not what you call musical. But sometimes I noticed the dripping of the lines has a nice rhythm to it, don't you think?

body.subject: Don't get your bag pipes in a bundle
body.text: It's all going to be just fine, lad. Go see Connie and Ron. They'll set you staight. Oh, did you see my little pet waterbug. Ok, ok. He's a roach. But he's a fine one... helped me out a bunch. Trade with me on my page if you want one of your own.

body.subject: A bonnie, bonnie slip joint
body.text: Great! Great! You're a real plumber now. Time to throw away your belt and get down to work getting the plumbing in your Craftsman Cottage Masterpiece running. When you're done, combine this with the other cottage substructures. Go see Ron Roofer, if you're missing the main blueprint. Best of luck lad.

body.subject: Ya don't know a Fip from a Dip?
body.text: Great! Great! Now, take this here Plumber's Apprentice Factory Module and with it, and a lovely creation of your own, you'll be on your way to getting your Plumber's License.

body.subject: Pride of the Agori
body.text: By the flames, you've done it! {Recipient} you are truly a hero among the Agori. Take this and transform your page and show the rest of the Network your remarkable achievement.[list]To Do List[/list][item]Go to Inventory and build your BIO Skin Item[item]Next go to Page Builder and into Edit Background[item]Now you can choose your new improved Public Skin

body.subject: Re: Gimme a Sticker!
body.text: Here's one from my favorite Soccer Team. Enjoy!

body.subject: I'm impressed!
body.text: This would make a great episode, wouldn't it? You have learned so much about construction. Way to go. As promised here's the blueprint for the Cottage Roof. Combine it with the other Cottage sub structures to make your Masterpiece. Remember, I offer the Craftsman Cottage Masterpiece Blueprint on my page for a small fee. Best of luck, and enjoy your new home. Doesn't it feel better knowing that you built it yourself?

body.subject: Stick Built
body.text: Ok, now that we have Form 20B let's take it one step at a time, just like on my show. Use this Framer's Apprentice Gallery Module to learn the basics of framing a house. It will eventually yield your Roofing License. Send that back to Mr. O Crat. He'll get your Roofing Permit, come see me when you have it.

body.subject: Thank you!
body.text: Well Well! Aren't you becoming a good cook! Here's my recipe for Apple Butter.

body.subject: Not bad!
body.text: Oh that was tasty - but I'm afraid not as good as my honey pie - I've attached the recipe. Send one back to me so I can make sure you did it right.

body.subject: Cook up some friendship!
body.text: Very pleased to make your acquaintance. You seem like the perfect friend to share some of my favorite family recipes with. I’ve heard from Farmer John that you make a mean Apple Pie. Well – I wouldn’t mind trying one for myself![list]Hint[/list][item]You will soon be short of Red LEGO Bricks, but you can get new Red LEGO Bricks if you go to your Page Builder and drag your LEGO Tree Module to the page. This module will give you 10 Red LEGO Bricks a day, so remember to harvest them on a regular basis from your public page. Later in the game you will get other modules that give you all sorts of new Items.

body.subject: Not so fast!
body.text: I'm sorry, it's not like me to turn people away, I'm a very busy woman though and I don't have time to teach you any of my family recipes if you can't even build the Crimson Apple yet. Go see Farmer John - if you send him an Apple Pie I bet he'll set you on the right track. Come back soon!

body.subject: Hop, Skip, Skip, Skip, Skip and a Jump! Jump!
body.text: Hi! Hi! Glad to see you've put your hard earned bricks to use. So hop to it and build your very own new MLN Hop Arcade Module. You can edit both the way the game looks and plays! Plays! See if your friends can beat your design. See you around the Network.[list]To Do[/list][item]Build Arcade Hop Module in your Inventory.[item]Go to Page Builder and Add Hop Module to your Public Page.[item]Go to Edit mode and design your own game.[item]Remember to play the game yourself.[item]Now go to your Public Page to set up the game. Use the attached Arcade Token to do this.[item]Have fun.

body.subject: Badges? Yes you do need some stinking badges!
body.text: Sorry partner! You gotta get yourself the Rank 4 flavor of them S.P.A. badges to be friends with me. Go see Patty Arch, the boss man, if you want anything further on the information of that there society.

body.subject: I know your face...
body.text: Were you at the Reisinger's Swan Lake in Moscow in... No, it must be your Great Great Great Grandparent. Oh well. Oh, right. I'm sorry I simply can't be friends without the Sticker Preservation Affiliate Badge, Rank 2. Patty's rule. He can be such a bore! But he let's me live here for free... I guess I should let him have his way. Sorry kid.

body.subject: Ready for your close up?
body.text: Welcome! I can see you've been around quite a while at LEGO.com. Perhaps not as long as me though! Haha. It seems like only yesterday they turned on their servers - 1994? 1996? Were you even born then? Don't answer that. Well... feel free to help yourself to my Sticker Vault Modules. You deserve it.

body.subject: Yeeehawww!
body.text: Why shoot! You musta had some LEGO Club Page there! I reckon you'll be an expert of this new fangled My LEGO Network in no time. Help yourself to all my stickers. You earned them! Also - be sure to build the rest of your S.P.A badges so you can get to friends with Patty, Nora and Zapp too.

body.subject: Welcome!
body.text: You're in good company with us here at the Sticker Preservation Affiliate. You've been assigned some badges, depending on how many LEGO Club Personal Page Stickers and Points you owned. If you have Rank 1 you can have all the classic Stickers on my page, Rank 2 my page and Nora Stalgia's. With a Rank 3 S.P.A. Badge you get access to Nora's, Zapp's and of course my page. If you happen to have a Rank 4 Badge, well color me impressed, you get the same as Rank 3 -plus access to Dusty's collection. Now remember, you need to construct each badge to befriend the S.P.A members and use their Sticker Vault Modules. Make sense? Good! Now go grab some classic stickers from my page!

body.subject: Adventure is still in the air!
body.text: Welcome good friend! I can see by your Badge you've been around here at LEGO.com quite a while. Excellent to have another vetran friend. Please feel free to grab anything you'd like from my Sticker Vault Modules.

body.subject: Not so fast young friend!
body.text: Although I can tell you are quite a brillant youngster, I'm afraid I must reject your invitation. You see only those who have a Sticker Preservation Affiliate, Rank 3 Badge can be my friend and access my sticker vaults.

body.subject: Sorry!
body.text: My sticker vaults are only for those who had a LEGO Club Page. Don't take it to heart, there's a lot of classic stickers to be found all around My LEGO Network.

body.subject: Aye, a sticker for ye!
body.text: Right, right. I take it by your stickery that you have chosen to side with us? The mighty House of Mantles! Right?

body.subject: Pick a side!
body.text: There are times in everyone’s life when they must take a side. I have cast my fortune with Prince Pell and the House of Mantles. He is the more worthy heir because…well, because he is! Remain neutral at your own peril!

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept once more. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept once more. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: Thank you so much for your help!
body.text: Thank you so much for helping inform us about our upcoming play concept once more. Please take this My LEGO Network prize package as a small token of our thanks. Remember to keep on creating!

body.subject: You're a game designer too?
body.text: Hi! Hi. This is amazing. You are one of the first users of the Concert I Arcade Module Blueprint. I really look forward seeing this game on your page. Maybe you will have the most popular game on My LEGO Network – that would be so cool! Cool. Ok, hurry up and go make your very own Concert game in Page Builder. This is what you need to do: Compose your music, design your game, test it and set it up on your Public page. Best of luck, my friend! Friend.[list]Hint[/list][item]Take this Arcade Token and use it to set up your Concert I Arcade Module, when your game is ready to be played.

body.subject: Exclusive BIO Code arrival
body.text: Thank you for entering your exclusive B.I.O. Code. As a reward, here is a special BIONICLE sticker for you to use in My LEGO Network. Place it into your inventory by clicking the "Collect Attachment" button above, and then you can use it in your Page Builder.[list]Join the Story![/list][item]Bara Magna needs a hero like you! Join me and the other Agori and Glatorians in My LEGO Network by visiting my MLN page a href="http://mln.lego.com/en-us/Network/default.aspx" here /a .

body.subject: You found it - shhh, its a secret ;)
body.text: Outstanding performance!

body.subject: Cross game Ace
body.text: Outstanding performance!

body.subject: Key to LEGO City
body.text: Good citizens of LEGO City. It is with great pleasure that award you with the Key to LEGO City for their heroic efforts in defeating Doctor Inferno. We are forever in your debt!

body.subject: Time and a half for you, Pal
body.text: All I gotta say is ‘wow.’ You did a great job out there in the tow truck! Here’s a little something to express my gratitude. Sure has been a crazy day here at LEGO City! If you haven’t already I would stop by Seymour Brickstein’s page on My LEGO Network and send him a friend request. He seems to have the inside scoop on why there’s so many wrecked vehicles. Speaking of which, we could really use your driving skills again when you get the chance.[list]Guide[/list][item]If you haven’t already - befriend Seymour Brickstein and Agent Chase by visiting their pages on My LEGO Network and clicking the “Add to Friend List Button”[item]Check your mailbox to see what they say[item]Play the game again to get more cool items!

body.subject: Cross game Rookie Agents
body.text: Excellent work. You drove that rig with nerves of steel, the Agency could really use somebody like you. Please take this as a small token of our appreciation. Although our intel is solid, I think it might be best to see if you could talk to Seymour Brickstein, if you haven’t already. He might help you get a better overview of the situation as we Agents are bit tied up chasing Dr. Inferno’s jeeps down. Speaking of which, we could really use your driving skills again when you get the chance.[list]Guide[/list][item]If you haven’t already - befriend Seymour Brickstein and Agent Chase by visiting their pages on My LEGO Network and clicking the “Add to Friend List Button”[item]Check your mailbox to see what they say[item]Play the game again to get more cool items!

body.subject: Operation Successful
body.text: Inferno really ate some dust on that last race, huh? You sure are one speedy dude. I attached your share of the race purse. If you haven’t already I would check in with Seymour Brickstein, he might have your photo finish covered. See you at the starting line next time![list]Guide[/list][item]If you haven’t already - befriend Seymour Brickstein and Peelie Wheelie by visiting their pages on My LEGO Network and clicking the “Add to Friend List Button”[item]Check your mailbox to see what they say[item]Play the game again to get more cool items!

body.subject: Cross game Intro mail
body.text: Outstanding performance!

body.subject: OK - a Worker bee is on its way.
body.text: OK - a Worker Bee is on it's way ;)

body.subject: Friendly Felix’s tuning troubles!
body.text: Terrible to hear of Felix’s tuning fork misfortunes! Luckily my tests have uncovered the trouble! Now where did I put those notes? Let’s see here... Hydrophonic-hula-loop plan? Oooh, nice; an old box of chocoblocks! Delicious!—Wait! Here they are! Right! The problem is that the creatotropic wavelength spectrum has shifted to a higher frequency, possibly due to the massive amount of imagination radiating from the Creation Lab! Felix needs a new tuning fork that’s been adjusted to the higher frequency! I’d give you a Retuned Tuning Fork Blueprint, but it mustn’t fall into the wrong hands! If you do the “My LEGO Network” challenge in the Creation Lab, I’ll know you’re a fun-lover and supply you the Retuned Tuning Fork Blueprint! [list]To Do List[/list][item]Visit the a href="http://universe.lego.com/creationlab/Default.aspx" Creation Lab /a on LEGO Universe website and upload your creation to "My LEGO Network".[item]Get your creation approved and go to unlock area to get the Retuned Tuning Fork Blueprint.

body.subject: I don’t think you’d last a night in the Jungle
body.text: You seem an honorable enough person. But in order for us to be friends I need some more proof that you can survive these harsh jungles. We Agori, from time to time, give our Honor Badges to outsiders such as yourselves for acts of bravery and battle. That would be proof enough for me - perhaps you could start your journey with Raanu in the village of Vulcanus?

body.subject: Greetings Friend!
body.text: And where are you from?... Really?! I’ve been there before! This song’s about it! 1…2…3…4…If the sun was shinin’…I’d sing about - Oh fiddlebricks! That sounds terrible; my tuning fork needs a fix! Do you know Professor Brickkeeper? He’s a fantastic friend! Could you please take my worn tuning fork to him for a mend? Though the problem is surely that bit of raggedy gear, I can’t leave to have it checked. I’m needed here! I’d give you a new arcade module for your trouble. With it you could craft musical games on the double! Thanks! Hurry back then! With your help I’ll soon be back to rockin’ again![list]To Do List[/list][item]Reply this message to Friendly Felix and ask for a hint to get the Worn Tuning Fork.[item]Mail Prof Brickkeeper the Worn Tuning Fork.[item]Check your mail.

body.subject: The Endless Ohm you desire
body.text: Brickkeeper sent you to aid Friendly Felix? Hmm… Powerful of mind is the Professor. You may come in for brickorish root tea, but --Zzzz…*SNORK!!*… shoes off! Nice socks. Please sit. Many moons has it taken me to master the --Zzzz…*SNORK!!*… snoring patterns of the Endless Ohm you seek. Only for a price would I trade a chanting of the Ohm. You see, few men dare face me--Zzzz…*SNORK!!*… even in practice battle. But with a Sparbot I could stay awake to continue building my skills. I know how to make this training machine, but I still need a few pieces. Great effort would be required to bring me the Sparbot parts, so we shall see how deeply you—Zzzz…*SNORK!!*… desire the Endless Ohm! [list]To Do List[/list][item]Trade for the Cannon Scrap required to build a Sparbot on Captain Jack Knife’s page.

body.subject: Missing Copy Jamie (Creator)
body.text: Missing Copy Jamie (Creator)

body.subject: Hey, Club Buddy!
body.text: Hi! You subscribe to LEGO Club Magazine too? That's great! Check out this month's magazine for awesome new LEGO sets, inside information and Cool Creations by LEGO Club members just like you! Being a LEGO Club Magazine subscriber you can have access to the special Club Magazine Modules for My LEGO Network! Awesome!

body.subject: Nope, sorry!
body.text: Sorry! My Club Magazine Modules are only for subscribers of the LEGO Club Magazine. Go to the a href="http://club.lego.com/" LEGO Club site /a and sign up today to recieve your LEGO Club Magazine Badge! If you are already a LEGO Club Magazine subscriber, check out the May/June issue of the Club Magazine for a special Club Code to recieve your badge!

body.subject: This is for you, my friend! Friend
body.text: Hi! Hi. Thank you so much for visiting our LEGO World Event, I really hope you had a cool time and saw some great LEGO models. Take this small token and put it on your page to let everybody else see that you are a true LEGO fan. Talk later and see you around the network.[list]Hint[/list][item]Click "Collect attachment" to add this badge to your Inventory[item]Now the badge is automatically visible on your Public page[item]If you are new to My LEGO Network, then check out Echo's first message to you[item]Have fun

body.subject: You found me!
body.text: Well... I guess that’s a good first step. But listen before we strike up a ‘friendship’ don’t you think you might want to stop my current campaign of evil? You know the one where I stomp through LEGO City with my giant robot? Hmmm? Oh, bother. If you don’t know what I’m talking about just go see that pesky television man - Seymour Brickstein.[list]To Do List[/list][item][item]Play the final level of The Robot Chronicles Game to get the Key to the City Badge.[item]If you haven’t already, go see Seymour Brickstein for more information on what to do.

body.subject: A little busy at the moment
body.text: Although I do love to chat with the fine citizens of LEGO City, we are little busy at the moment. In case you haven’t noticed, Doctor Inferno is reeking havoc in our downtown![list]To Do List[/list][item]Play the 3 first levels of The Robots Chronicles and get the Headline Badge.[item]Then defeat Dr Inferno to receive a token of my gratitude.[item]If you haven’t already, go see Seymour Brickstein for more information on what to do.[item]Play well!

body.subject: This is a secret...
body.text: OK, my Friend. This is very secret and please don't tell how you got this cool Blueprint. You are about to be one if the first users in MLN to own this new Acade Delivery Game, so make the best game ever and you will get a lot of respect from rest of the Network.[list]Instructions[/list][item]Collect this Blueprint and build your Arcade Delivery Module in your Inventory.[item]Drag the module to your page and enter the Edit mode.[item]Design your game and make it public from your Public page.[item]Play well.

body.subject: Hey there old-timer!
body.text: Golly! Why I can see you've been around since even before the LEGO Club Personal Pages. Well shucks - I thought my boots were worn, but I reckon you could even teach me a thing or two about LEGO.com. I do rightly think here old-timer badge should really show off your years to those green, newbie Networkers. Enjoy the trail!

body.subject: Join us!
body.text: Well golly! Aren’t you quite the page builder!? Well kid, congratulations to you. You’ve reached the highest ranks of the S.P.A. My hat’s off to you. Take this S.P.A. Badge Rank 4 it will allow you access to my personal sticker vaults.

body.subject: Join us!
body.text: Well… aren’t you quite the LEGO.com star. I’ll try not to get jealous. Patty told me about your many accomplishments with your LEGO Club Personal Page. I’d like to help you out – take this S.P.A. Badge Rank 3. It will allow you access to my personal sticker vaults.

body.subject: For Freedom! For Justice! For Stickers!
body.text: Hello there young rocketeer! Patty has told me all about you. It seems you’re a hero in the making. Well, I wanted to help you get started with your sticker collection here in My LEGO Network. This S.P.A. Badge Rank 2 will allow you access to my personal sticker vaults.

body.subject: Join us!
body.text: The Sticker Preservation Affliate has taken a keen interest in you. We recognize your loyality and appriecation of the old ways of LEGO.com. Please take the attached gifts, consider them a jump start to show this new "Network" a thing or two about sticker collecting. This S.P.A. Badge Rank 1 will allow you access to my personal sticker vaults.

body.subject: Application for Foundation Permit Accepted
body.text: Yes, yes. All is in order, just the way I like it. Here's your permit. Good Day.

body.subject: Thanks buddy!
body.text: You are a true friend! Thank you so much for your reply. I will let Captain Jack Knife know, and just between the two of us - he is one of my favorites too ;)[list]Wanna join and need some help?[/list][item]Befriend Professor Brickkeeper and Friendly Felix[item]Get the Worn Tuning Fork from Friendly Felix.[item]Join the My LEGO Network Challenge in the Creation Lab on LEGO Universe website.[item]Get your creation approved.[item]Now trade for the Creation Lab Badge Blueprint to get going.[item]Good luck ;)

body.subject: Thanks buddy!
body.text: You are a true friend! Thank you so much for your reply. I will let Numb Chuck know, and just between the two of us - he is one of my favorites too ;)[list]Wanna join and need some help?[/list][item]Befriend Professor Brickkeeper and Friendly Felix[item]Get the Worn Tuning Fork from Friendly Felix.[item]Join the My LEGO Network Challenge in the Creation Lab on LEGO Universe website.[item]Get your creation approved.[item]Now trade for the Creation Lab Badge Blueprint to get going.[item]Good luck ;)

body.subject: Thanks buddy!
body.text: You are a true friend! Thank you so much for your reply. I will let Friendly Felix know, and just between the two of us - he is one of my favorites too ;)[list]Wanna join and need some help?[/list][item]Befriend Professor Brickkeeper and Friendly Felix[item]Get the Worn Tuning Fork from Friendly Felix.[item]Join the My LEGO Network Challenge in the Creation Lab on LEGO Universe website.[item]Get your creation approved.[item]Now trade for the Creation Lab Badge Blueprint to get going.[item]Good luck ;)

body.subject: Thanks buddy!
body.text: You are a true friend! Thank you so much for your reply. I will let Professor Brickkeeper know, and just between the two of us - he is one of my favorites too ;)[list]Wanna join and need some help?[/list][item]Befriend Professor Brickkeeper and Friendly Felix[item]Get the Worn Tuning Fork from Friendly Felix.[item]Join the My LEGO Network Challenge in the Creation Lab on LEGO Universe website.[item]Get your creation approved.[item]Now trade for the Creation Lab Badge Blueprint to get going.[item]Good luck ;)

body.subject: Help? Really?
body.text: Use Grazing Dinos on your friend's page. Carnivores get built into your Ambush Modules. Yeah - it's your choice kiddo.

body.subject: Transmorphing Treasures
body.text: Magical essence float's from {Sender}'s Transmuting Pool.

body.subject: With Star Justice for All!
body.text: Great work! You’re now a member of Star Justice. You might have been tempted to join Space Skulls during your covert work on your last mission. Yes, we checked your ship log. I’m afraid that’s going to be impossible now with your new official status with us. See you around!

body.subject: Skulls for life!
body.text: Welcome my friend! You’re now one of us. I can’t say we are the most trustworthy group – so I would watch your back, we’ve been known to even steal from each other. I’m afraid your chances of getting in good with Star Justice is now impossible – you’re running with Space Skulls now!

body.subject: Space Age!
body.text: A couple of collectors of fine art collectors told me you have new gallery module. I just wanted to drop you a line and say I’m hear to help if you need any assistance getting your creative photos up on your page. I’m something of an expert in galleries. Drop by my page and befriend me to learn more. Ciao!

body.subject: Sorry Pal!
body.text: Hey, if you can't build the Giant's Hat Masterpiece, you can't come in my Scrap Yard. Simple as that. But hey, come back when you can, ok?

body.subject: OK - an Autominer Bot is on its way.
body.text: OK - an Autominer Bot is on it's way ;)

body.subject: OK - a Black LEGO Brick is on its way.
body.text: OK - a Black LEGO Brick is on it's way ;)

body.subject: OK - a White LEGO Brick is on its way.
body.text: OK - a White LEGO Brick is on it's way ;)

body.subject: OK - I have a Seal of the P.O.S.
body.text: Sure - I have a Seal of the P.O.S. and would just love some Orange LEGO Bricks ;)

body.subject: OK - a Treason Beaver is on its way.
body.text: OK - a Treason Beaver is on it's way ;)

body.subject: Error! Could Not Reject Invitation
body.text: Error: The system could not reject {Sender}'s invitation. Wow! They must be very charming.

body.subject: I welcome such a worthy ally!
body.text: Welcome to the fray, fellow warrior! Be on thy guard, there are spies from the accursed House of Gauntlets everywhere. Be sure thou hast the proper equipment for protection, and find thyself some shelter.

body.subject: Nebular Reward!
body.text: You discover a hidden crystal from {Sender}'s Page!

body.subject: Nebular Reward!
body.text: You discover a hidden crystal from {Sender}'s Page!

body.subject: Nebular Reward!
body.text: You discover a hidden crystal from {Sender}'s Page!

body.subject: Nebular Reward!
body.text: You discover a hidden crystal from {Sender}'s Page!

body.subject: Nebular Reward!
body.text: You discover a hidden crystal from {Sender}'s Page!

body.subject: BIO Code arrival
body.text: Thank you for entering your B.I.O. Code. As a reward, here is a special BIONICLE sticker for you to use in My LEGO Network. Place it into your inventory by clicking the “Collect Attachment” button above, and then you can use it in your Page Builder.[list]Join the Story![/list][item]Bara Magna needs a hero like you! Join me and the other Agori and Glatorians in My LEGO Network by visiting my MLN page a href="http://mln.lego.com/en-us/Network/default.aspx" here /a .

body.text: Thank you for entering your B.I.O. Code. As a reward, here is a special BIONICLE sticker for you to use in My LEGO Network. Join me and the other Agori and Glatorians in My LEGO Network by visiting my MLN page a href="http://mln.lego.com/en-us/Network/default.aspx" here /a .
